resources.string: <g id="male_think" />I see a clarity in your eyes, a wisdom I haven't seen since… well,<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" /> in quite some time.
<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />These days are indeed dark, but even darker ones are approaching. I hope you are prepared for them.
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />Hello there, wayfarer. I see you're a newcomer to Corinth. You should speak with Captain Dupont if you haven't already.
<g id="grace_secret" />I have to tell you, when those squatters on the beach mentioned a town up the road, <g id="grace_yes" />I expected more than this.
<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />This soddy wee village is on the verge of extinction. <g id="grace_headshakeno" />Not much gold to be had around here.
<g id="female_thinking" />It's strange, isn't it, returning to a place you once called home and hardly recognizing it?
<g id="female_nodshrugokay" />I would have assumed it was my faulty memories, but no, it's the town. <g id="g_male_headnodyes" bin="1.5" bout="1.5"/>Things were much more… harmonious back then.
<g id="sit_laughmed" />Welcome to the breadbasket of Aeternum, stranger!
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />We don't have much food to spare at present, but I can assure you, it's a temporary problem! <g id="sit_nod" />We'll be back! As surely as day follows night!
Corinth isn't so bad. We've still got food, for now, at least. The Speaker promises things will be better soon.
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />History gives a strong perspective on the present.
<g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />How can you make sure you don't repeat the mistakes of the past if you don't actually study them?
These are troublesome times. And my delectable treats could bring much needed joy to people.
But the countryside is so dangerous I can't get back to my kitchen. And I really don't like camping.
When times are tough, people are nervous. And nervous people want armor.
I'm flattered my work is being appreciated, but it's been difficult keeping up with the demand.
<g id="sit_headtilthmm" />Did you see that? No? Ah, well. Maybe next time. When you're a hunter like me, you learn to keep a sharp eye out.
<g id="male_pleadHandsclasped" />How did you manage to get past the Lost? Those spectres are everywhere! <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />There's no escaping them!
I've always wanted to join the Iron Rose Company. They're a brave lot.
They saved me from a grisly death when I was new here. I'd be haunting this island as a Lost if it weren't for them.
Have you seen the spheres? Aren't they magnificent? I wonder what they were used for…
This land is empty… as empty as my dreams.
My farm is ruined. What am I to do now? Death is temporary, but suffering seems to spring eternal here.
Aeternum is an island of exotic people and strange beasts, mystical powers, and new lands that need charting.
There is so little we understand, but we must always start with the ground beneath our feet.
This is a big problem you see. The shortages here in Windsward are just awful!
I haven't been able to create any new clothes. Sadly there just aren't enough supplies to be spared.
Have you found any Ancient tombs? How better to learn about how they lived than to study how they treated their dead!
Though I suppose death is somewhat fluid here… I simply must continue my studies!
There's so much inspiration to be found here, you know? I could spend years painting the pastoral landscapes of Windsward.
Welcome to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home! Do you wish to check in? We'd be happy to have you!
Have you tried the tea? I find it is most calming.
Oh dear, you spooked me! I'm a little nervous wandering around out here on my own.
[A set of well maintained brushes rests here. Somone must have left them behind.]
The journal looks like a trove of knowledge. But the size makes you wonder if it was left here on purpose.
<g id="guard_dismissLeft" />Another new face in Corinth just means another mouth to feed, <g id="guard_headshakeno" />and we don't have the food. Wherever you came from, I suggest you go back.

<g id="guard_nod" />You there... new to Corinth, are you? <g id="guard_headshakeno" />Last thing we need's another mouth to feed. <g id="guard_headshakeno" />No bread to spare for traveling vagrants! <g id="guard_dismissLeft" />Go back to where you came from.
"I came from the beach."
<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />Did you, then? Does that mean you've got news of the storm? <g id="guard_nod" />Heard rumors there's Corrupted swarming all over down there.
Feast to Famine
Speak with the Elder Saatvik Agrawal to find out if you're welcome in Corinth.
Speak with Francis Turner, Speaker of the Winds

<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />As if we don't have enough problems… everyone talking about some ancient curse on the land! <g id="guard_headshakeno" />Last thing we need is to have to worry about Corrupted as well.
"But the Corrupted are a threat."
<g id="guard_laughmed" />Well, isn't that grand? People starving in the streets, everyone whispering the Sorceress Medea's cursed us, <g id="guard_shrugbrief" />and now tidings of evil. What's next?

<g id="guard_dismissLeft" />Look, the Speaker of the Winds is in charge. <g id="guard_nod" />Talk to him if you like, but <g id="guard_headshakeno" />don't expect some kind of welcome banquet. Corinth's gone from feast to famine.
"What caused the famine?"

<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />Ask five people, you'll get five theories. <g id="guard_dismissLeft" />Some say we've been cursed, others blame the local druids. <g id="guard_headshakeno" />Don't make a damn bit of difference, if you ask me.

<g id="guard_dismissLeft" />Go see the Speaker in the Town Hall if you want to gab any more. <g id="guard_nod" />That bastard loves to talk. After that, I suggest <g id="guard_nod" />you be moving on.
<g id="guard_headtilthmm" />Something else you need? If so, I suggest you look elsewhere. <g id="guard_dismissLeft" />Move along… else you want trouble.
...calling for patience will not suffice at this point, Francis. This is clearly a curse.
God’s ears, Saatvik! Your penchant for exaggeration never abates! More superstitions about the witch Medea, infuriated because she didn’t get her wagon-load of coin and fruit?
This is precisely what she threatened if we failed to send tribute…
That was over a century ago, and I’ve told you already - we sent the damn tribute! These rumors are drivel… spread by the druids, no doubt!
Rumors or not, we have no choice but to venture out and try to salvage what we can from the farms.
I’ve heard enough for today, Elder Saatvik. Let it rest… it’s not like anyone is going to die of starvation on this infernal island.
The people of Corinth are suffering, Francis… becoming Lost! If you don’t do something, I will!
...calling for patience will not suffice at this point, Francis.
This is clearly a curse.
God’s ears, Saatvik! Your penchant for exaggeration never abates! More superstitions about the witch Medea?
Infuriated because she didn’t get her wagon-load of coin and fruit?
This is precisely what she threatened if we failed to send tribute…
That was over a century ago, and I’ve told you already - we sent the damn tribute!
These rumors are drivel… spread by the druids, no doubt!
Rumors or not, we have no choice but to venture out and try to salvage what we can from the farms.
I’ve heard enough for today, Elder Saatvik.
Let it rest… it’s not like anyone is going to die of starvation on this infernal island.
The people of Corinth are suffering, Francis… becoming Lost!
[Chuckles]
If you don’t do something, I will!

<g id="sit_laughmed" />Haha! A fresh, healthy face with a spark of hope in your eyes! <g id="sit_nod" />That's what we need around here! <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />Less of this moping about and finger-pointing.

<g id="sit_headshakeno" />Elder Saatvik goes around preaching curses on every corner. <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />If he keeps it up, he'll cause a panic! <g id="sit_nod" />How about some good tidings, for once?
"I have news of the Corrupted."

<g id="sit_headshakeno" />See now, why <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />spoil our pleasant conversation with such dark business? <g id="sit_laughmed" />You're new to Corinth! You should check in at the inn! <g id="sit_nod" />Yes, put your feet up!

Whatever you do, <g id="sit_headshakeno" />please don't go worrying everyone about the Corrupted! <g id="sit_nod" />I'll deal with that problem when it comes! <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />Or Elder Saatvik will, he seems to enjoy it.
"Should I speak with the Elder?"

<g id="sit_nod" />By all means! See if you can help the man come to his senses… <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />before he worries so much he falls Lost himself. <g id="sit_laughmed" />Good luck! You'll need it with Saatvik!
Hehe, Elder Saatvik, <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />when will he learn? When confronted with confidence, <g id="sit_nod" />these problems solve themselves!
So you talked to the Speaker, did you? Heh. And now back on the road. That's for the best, I think.
Poor wretched thing… I’m sorry for this…
Even with this demoralizing display, the Speaker chooses ignorance.
Winston here baked the best bread in Corinth… now he’s a nothing more than a soulless beast.
The Lost… we call them, and their numbers grow as ours dwindle… all across Windsward.

<g id="litearmor_gestureright" />You see this poor, wretched thing? A month ago, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />my friend Winston here baked the best bread in Corinth! Now… this is his fate for all eternity.
<g id="litearmor_hopeless" />The Lost… we call them, and their numbers <g id="litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />grow as ours dwindle… all across Windsward.
Rest Assured
Visit the Inn and speak with Innkeep Verildis Jannsen to check in. Discover an old friend at the Inn.
Check in with the Innkeep at the Southern Breeze Inn

<g id="litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />Even with this demoralizing display, the Speaker chooses ignorance! <g id="litearmor_crossarmsupset" />He brushes off any suggestion the Sorceress Medea's cursed us.
"Who's Medea and why the curse?"

<g id="litearmor_tiltheadremember" />That's a long and sordid tale… suffice to say - Medea hasn't been seen here in decades, <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />but Corinth pays regular tribute to the Sorceress.

<g id="litearmor_darnit" />Of course, the Speaker insists the tribute was sent and that the druids invited this disaster. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Either way, the situation is dire, and growing worse.
"What can I do to help?"

<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />I prefer not to recruit a newcomer for such a dangerous enterprise, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />but the truth is, if we don't salvage what we can from the farms, starvation will bring more Lost.

But please, before you do anything else, <g id="litearmor_gestureright" />check in at the inn. Take what time you need. <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />And then I'll be calling a meeting in the tavern. If you're inclined.
"Alright. I'll come to the tavern."

<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />Thank you. Nice to speak with someone not miserable or insane. <g id="litearmor_think" />There's another newcomer, a rather feisty young woman. <g id="litearmor_agree1" />You'll likely see her at the inn.
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />Please, speak with the inkeep at the Southern Breeze. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Even travelers need a place they can call home for a night!
Welcome to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home! You wish to check in? Now this is a pleasant surprise, two new customers in one day!
Welcome back to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home! Do you wish to check in? We'd be happy to have you!
<g id="grace_welcome" />Where've you been hiding? I was afraid I'd have to go back to the beach and search for you.
<g id="grace_secret" />Not that I wanted to stay here, mind you! This hamlet's ready for a bloody wake!
"Yes, it has problems."
<g id="grace_chuckle" />Problems? I've raided tombs more lively than this place!
<g id="grace_shifty" priority="high"/>I don't plan on hanging around here long, not when the winds are shifting the way they are. <g id="grace_no" />It's bad business.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Whether the Speaker is willing to help or not, <g id="litearmor_agree1" />I have no choice but to take action to help the people of Corinth.
Money Talks
Visit the Trading Post and one of the Storage Sheds in Corinth. Then speak with Grace at the Inn.
Open the Trading Post
Open a Storage Shed
Return to the Inn to speak with Grace
<g id="grace_bowHead" priority="high" />I managed to sell that loot we collected. <g id="grace_handheart" />Never let it be said that Grace O'Malley doesn't pay her debts!
<g id="grace_giveitem" priority="high"/>Here's your share of the coin. <g id="grace_headnodyes" />I think you should get to spending it.
"What should I spend it on?"
<g id="grace_gestureL" />There's a trading post here. Not exactly thriving, <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />but you could at least get yourself some new clothes.
<g id="grace_lean" />I'm telling you this as a friend - you smell like something that washed in with the tide.
"I believe I did."
<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />Well, there ya have it then! You can always count on your pal Grace <g id="grace_headnodyes" />to give it to you straight.

<g id="grace_gestureLeftM" />Go on to the Trading Post and get yourself some gear. <g id="grace_gestureBehind" />Then meet me in the tavern. Must be at least some action over there. <g id="grace_headnodyes" />We'll see, won't we?
<g id="grace_gesturebothhands" />You have all that coin jingling in your pockets. <g id="grace_convince2" />Go and spend it! And you never know when someone might steal it when you're not looking.
Even on Aeternum, civilization is built on a foundation of lies. Together, you and I can tear it down and rebuild…

<g id="grace_doubt" />Well there's a pretty little ditty for you… some romanticized notions of Aeternum, I'd say. <g id="grace_headshakeno" />Grace O'Malley won't be calling this place home. I'll tell you that.
<g id="grace_secret" />The real tragedy of Corinth is there's no way a girl can make some quick money around here!

<g id="grace_chuckle" />This Elder Saatvik fellow came in, <g id="grace_yes" />trying to rally folks to go out and salvage crops from the farms, <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />but he offered no reward!
<g id="grace_convince1" />Heh. Poor bastard didn't get a single volunteer. Went out on his own... <g id="grace_headshakeno" />Barkeep says he'll probably become a soulless Lost himself…
Desperate Measures
Visit Golden Fields to gather food to resupply Corinth.
Help Quartermaster Saatvik salvage Supplies from the {POITags}
Talk to Saatvik Agrawal at {POITags}
Fix the first windmill
Fix the second windmill
Collect Sacks of Grain
Collect Harvested Vegetables
Return to Elder Saatvik's Cart
Fill the Cart with Grain and Vegetables
"Maybe we should help him?"
<g id="grace_pshaw" />Hah! That'll be the day! I'm no farmer, and besides, <g id="grace_lean" />I caught wind of a pirate hideout not so far from town. Thinking maybe there's some loot there.

<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />But you're the hero, right? Just like old… whatever-his-name-was at the beach. <g id="grace_yes" />If you want to give a hand to old Saatvik, I'm sure he'll make use of it.
"Where did he go?"
<g id="grace_pointL" />To the farms north of town. He was practically begging folks to go with him, so <g id="grace_yes" />I'm sure he'll be damn glad to see you.

<g id="grace_handheart" />I'll linger here a bit, and then check out these pirates. <g id="grace_sympathy" />Don't get yourself into trouble. I'd hate to lose the only other sane person on the island.
<g id="grace_understand" />Like I said, I'll be seeing you around. Long as you don't go losing your soul somewhere. <g id="grace_frustrated" />Ah here... I can't believe I'm even saying these things.
<g id="grace_disappointed" />Not much luck finding any coin… or even any leads for finding coin, not around here. <g id="grace_understand" />Seems like these pirates might be the best bet.
"If we're immortal, why eat?"
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />Immortal doesn't mean we're immune from death. <g id="litearmor_agree1" />On the contrary, you'll find there are many ways you can die on Aeternum.
"And eating food prevents that?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Eating food is a way to make your time here more pleasant. <g id="litearmor_agree1" />It's amazing how much better people feel after a hearty meal.
"What does it mean to be 'Lost'?"
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />It’s a wretched semblance of life, a body without a soul.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />We may not age here, but our minds do. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />Some give in to despair and madness, others lose themselves completely. There’s nothing worse.

<g id="male_darnit" priority=""high" />How many times do I have to tell people? We sent the damn tribute! No matter, <g id="female_shrugDontcare" />Captain Dupont will soon sort out who's been spreading such nasty rumors.
<g id="litearmor_darnit" />The scene here is unthinkable. A month ago, <g id="litearmor_converseleft" />the most flourishing fields in all Aeternum. <g id="litearmor_gestureright" />Now, this.
<g id="litearmor_hopeless" />The Druids were such gentle people, and now <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />they're these Lost Swarmancers, destroying the land.
"Can the crops be salvaged?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I hope so, because we need it. <g id="litearmor_gestureright" />We must get the Windmills going again, and then recover any sacks of grain that remain untainted.
<g id="litearmor_shakehead" />But the Lost Swarmancers and Withered are everywhere!
"I'll do it."
<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />Ha ha! You're a brave soul, my friend. I’d protest... if the need weren't so dire.

<g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Look for any farmers who need rescuing, and <g id="litearmor_agree1" />bring back any sacks of grain you find. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />And for your own sake, be careful!
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Well, it's not as much as I'd hoped, but it's certainly better than nothing. <g id="litearmor_agree1" />This grain will keep us fed for a few more days at least.
<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />With the windmills turning again, at least there's hope for the future.
<g id="litearmor_headtilthmm" />Did you see anyone out there who hasn't become Lost? <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />The Druids, the farmers, surely someone remains.
<g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />I know many fled, but <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />it's strange that I've heard no firsthand accounts of how it happened.
Firsthand Accounts
Rescue and talk to farmers who survived what happened at Golden Fields.
"I'll check the rest of the farm."

<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />Your confidence seems matched by your skill, so I welcome the help. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Indeed, if you rescue anyone you can find, <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />we might be able to get some answers.
"I can search for more food too."
<g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />Oh… Good thinking! This farm produced a bountiful crop of fruits and vegetables as well.

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />The fields are cursed now, but <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />there are crates of food that have already been harvested. <g id="litearmor_gestureright" />Go on then, I'll wait here.
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />If there are any farmers, or Druids, I hope they can give us some insight into exactly what transpired here.
Rescue Farmer Lijsbet
Rescue Farmer Michael
Rescue Druid Acolyte Nessa
(Optional) Gather Carrots, Corn, or Barley
Speak with farmer Michael
Speak with Druid Acolyte Nessa
Shhh! They'll hear you, and believe me, we don't want that!
"The way is clear now."
Thank you. My family, my farm, all Lost… I'm the only one left.
What are you doing here? How did you get past the Withered?
"It's safe, you can go."
Oh, bless you, my friend! I felt my hope fading away! I almost became Withered!

<g id="female_whattheheck" />What a mess! Nothing in my studies prepared me for this. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />I came looking for the other druids, and somehow, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I got a bit… surrounded, I suppose.
"The path is clear now."
<g id="male_shocked" />It is? Oh, well, I would've figured it out soon enough, <g id="male_willcoverit" />but thank you nonetheless. Meet me at the edge of the farm. We should talk.
<g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />After what I've seen, I fear eternal life may become eternal torment. <g id="male_concernS" />It's a sight that will haunt me all my days.
<g id="female_whattheheck" priority="high"/>Watching my sweet Therese consumed by beetles, and then rise up again as a Withered…
"How did it start?"

<g id="male_gestureLeft" priority="high" />I was by the mill, watching as the Druids spread their verdant blessings. <g id="female_whattheheck" />Then suddenly, the blessings turned putrid and began emitting green smoke!
<g id="female_disappointed" priority="high" />The Druid nearest me just fell over… and transformed!
"So maybe it was the Druids?"

<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />I just can't believe that! They've always been kind and generous. <g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />They often spoke of a Verdant Spirit who watched over Windsward. It was a lovely story…
<g id="male_shakehead" />I can't stay here. Too many memories destroyed along with these fields.
<g id="female_worry"/>Oh dear, did no one else come through this with their souls intact? It should've <g id="male_willcoverit"/>been me who fell Lost. The others were newer to the island.
"Did you see how it began?"
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />No, I was napping in my old chair, when I was startled awake by a Withered bursting through the door!
<g id="male_think" />I think it was young Harrison, poor boy... I ran and hid, and <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />saw nothing more until you came.

<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />I've been on this island longer than I can recall, and I've rebuilt my life many times. But I'm so tired… <g id="male_shrugBrief" />I can't start over again. I simply don't have the heart…
<g id="female_whattheheck" />How did the farms deteriorate so quickly? <g id="male_shakehead" />It just doesn't make sense.
<g id="female_thinking" />Hmm. Transforming druids into swarmancers, that's not human magic. <g id="female_leanpointConvince" />That seems like the magic of the island itself.
"Why weren't you affected?"
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I've only just returned from completing my druidic studies at another warren in the north. <g id="male_guiltyLookdown" />Whatever happened here, I missed it.

<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" priority="high" />It appears all the other druids fell Lost from one day to the next! <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />If I didn't know better,<g id="female_smackfist" /> I'd say this is some kind of curse.
"From the Sorceress Medea?"

<g id="female_shakeheadNo" />Not likely. <g id="female_fingerwagNo" />I've never heard of anyone who could snap their fingers and turn people Lost.<g id="male_agree1" /> If such magic exists, I'd like to know more about it myself.

<g id="female_spreadarms" /> Do you know the history of this region? Ah, well, <g id="male_willcoverit" />I'm something of an expert on Windsward. It's a bit of a tale, but I think it'll help you understand…
<g id="male_explain" />I realize that sounds a bit dour, but it is the truth of it. <g id="male_converseleft" />The question now is what's behind all this mess and how we go about cleaning it up.
"Could the druids cause this?"

<g id="female_disagreecrossarms" />Not intentionally. It certainly didn't turn out well for them, did it?<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" /> But it's possible some unfortunate effort to bless the land went astray.

<g id="female_whattheheck" />Ah... that blowhard Speaker of the Winds is pushing that theory, isn't he? <g id="female_disappointed" />Buffoon. At least we have Elder Saatvik. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />It's good of you to help him.
"Whatever I can do… "

<g id="male_complimentplayer" />I commend your attitude. I'm sure whatever you accomplish with Elder Saatvik will be worthwhile. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I do hope we meet again. <g id="male_bowShallow" />Until then, fare thee well!
<g id="female_thinking" />I wonder if there's a way…? No one's ever come back from being Lost, but there's a first time for everything, right?
<g id="female_nodyes" />If I'm the last Druid remaining in Windsward, then it's my duty to try.
"You're the last druid?"
<g id="female_notsure" />I'm not certain of anything at this point. <g id="male_gestureLeft" priority="high" />The main warren, where I started my studies, lies to the west.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I'll go there to see if any of my fellow Druids remain. <g id="female_nodyes" />There's a good chance, I think. Or at least, I hope…

<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />This business about the tribute to Medea sounds suspicious, <g id="male_shrugBrief" />but that can't be the cause of all this. No it's something in the magic of the land. It has to be…
<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />That, my friend, was most impressive! These vegetables may make all the difference.
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />I spoke to the farmers you rescued. They said you also rescued a druid? <g id="litearmor_headtilthmm" />What did she say?
"Nessa. She was in the north."
<g id="litearmor_think" />Hm, she must be an initiate. They train up north.
<g id="litearmor_converseleft" />Perhaps she can help us make sense of all this. <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />I don't think the Speaker is on the right track, not at all.
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />The Speaker insists he sent Medea's tribute, <g id="litearmor_realize" />which means it would've been carted off by the Iron Rose Mercenaries.
<g id="litearmor_handshipsconsider" />They're supposed to be protecting these farms as well, but I haven't seen hide nor hair of them.
Tracking the Tribute
Visit the Iron Rose Garrison and find out what happened to the Sorceress Medea's Tribute.
Search for Clues to the Missing Tribute at the Iron Rose Garrison
"The Iron Rose Mercenaries?"
<g id="litearmor_agree1" />Yes, they were hired by Medea herself, to protect and transport the tribute, <g id="litearmor_converseright" />but the town had engaged them for security as well.
<g id="litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />I haven't seen a single member of the Iron Rose Company since this whole thing started.
"Where would they be?"
<g id="litearmor_gesturebackthere" />The Iron Keep lies to the northwest. If you can go and find out about the Tribute, <g id="litearmor_agree1" />it may help us solve this dilemma.
<g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />I should get these goods back to town where they're desperately needed. Good luck!
<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />Uh, while I appreciate your help gathering food for Corinth, we need to know why the Company of the Iron Rose wasn't here to protect the farm.

"What happened?"

<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />No, we, we, we fought bravely. <g id="male_willcoverit" />But when my comrades began to fall,<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" /> I realized they were returning as Lost.

<g id="male_giveup" />It's over, man! It's all over! Everyone's fallen Lost! <g id="female_lookaroundshifty" priority="high"/>And they're trying to make me Lost, too! I may already be turning! Oath be damned! <g id="male_wavehandsnobig" priority="high"/>I quit… I'm done!

<g id="male_willcoverit" />Now listen, I want the truth and to prove <g id="male_nodunderstand" />the Iron Rose didn't fail in its duty, <g id="male_righthandNodeal" /> but I can't raise arms against my fallen comrades again. Not yet.

<g id="male_willcoverit" />I'll head to Corinth and see the Speaker of the Winds. Meet me there after the keep. <g id="male_pointRight" />There's a shrine nearby to speed you on your way. <g id="male_bowShallow" priority="high"/>Good luck, soldier.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You're a brave soul to go charging in to fight the members of my order. Even Lost, they will be formidable.

I do not need your excuses, Commander. 

The Tribute for the season has not arrived on schedule, and as you well know, this is a breach of my contract with the Iron Rose and with the town of Corinth.

Whoever holds the title of Speaker of the Winds these days, they should be reminded of the consequences that are described in detail in the original covenant.

If this situation is not remedied quickly, and to my satisfaction, further reparations will be expected.

I will not hesitate to visit Windsward myself and personally see that the cost is paid for these trangressions. 

Yours in candor and quickly-decreasing patience,
 Medea

By order of the Speaker of the Winds, I'm writing to inform the Iron Rose Company that the city guard will be escorting the tribute to Medea. 
The Iron Rose is relieved of the responsibility for this season. I will be escorting the tribute myself, so you needn't be worried for its security. 

Guard Captain Dupont

<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" />It's good to see you… heh, <g id="male_chuckle" />almost called you 'comrade'! I'm glad you made it safely. <g id="female_spreadarms" />It seems this disaster has spread all across Windsward.
<g id="female_takeAndGiveItem8s" priority="high" />What did you find in the Iron Keep? A correspondence from Medea…? Let me see. Ah, god's blood, she is not happy!

<g id="male_think" />So all this means the tribute never made it to Medea, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />but I still don't understand, if the Iron Rose didn't have the tribute, who did?

<g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" />That beady-eyed little bastard! I'll see <g id="male_righthandAngry" />him tarred and feathered if this is his fault, <g id="male_realize" />but wait… if Dupont took the tribute, <g id="male_pointleft"/>the Speaker would've known.

<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />Ah! The hero who restored our Windmills returns from the field! <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Gratitude is in short supply in Corinth these days, <g id="female_bowDeep" priority="high"/>but I, for one, salute your courage!

<g id="male_quidproquo" priority="high"/> As was my right! That witch Medea -if she's still there - has robbed us for decades, <g id="male_righthandAngry" />giving nothing in return but some legend of magical protections.

<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" />I sent Dupont to learn the truth. How could I know he'd be waylaid on the road? <g id="male_pointBlame" />Even so, if Medea wants a war over it, then dammit, we should give her one!

<g id="male_waghand03"priority="high" />Of course not! The town wants to continue appeasing Medea, so I've tried! <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Even now, if we can recover the tribute, I'll send it! <g id="male_compliment" />You can help!
<g id="female_nodding" />Talk to Captain Dupont. He'll give you the details.
<g id="female_youknow" />The sorceress has been waiting for an excuse like this. <g id="female_nodyes" />It's a cauldron that's been boiling for too long! We'll see, sure enough.

<g id="male_wavehandsNo" />Alright, slow down, hero! We're all mad about the stolen tribute, myself included, but<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" /> going out there to reclaim it <g id="male_shakehead" />won't be a walk on the beach.

<g id="female_spreadarms" />The pirates that hit us are a tough crew. <g id="female_pointThreaten" />If you want to volunteer to take them on yourself, be my guest, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />but I ain't going anywhere.

<g id="female_leanpointConvince" />People are saying those pirates are Lost now, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />so that just means they're all the more ruthless, <g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />so go on, hero, let's see <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />how you fare against that outfit.

<g id="male_nodproud" />I think the Speaker and that fool Dupont are hiding something, and when I find out what it is, <g id="female_smackfist" />they'll answer for it. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />I promise you that.

<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />Still, if the tribute can be reclaimed, it's worth trying. But going up against the Buccaneer Creek Pirates… <g id="male_shakehead" />that will be ugly. Won't find many volunteers.

<g id="male_chuckle" />I knew you'd say that. Just be careful. <g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />Those brigands are crafty as hell. I'd come, but I've got to find <g id="female_nodyes" />someone in this damn town I can trust first…

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Of course, now he and Dupont have fallen back on the classic "the pirates' did it" excuse.

Captain Dauti, I know we haven't always seen eye-to-eye in the past, but I would invite to join me in an endeavor that will be mutually advantageous.

As I know you're aware, the town of Corinth has been paying tribute to the sorceress Medea for generations - an arrangement that I believe has run its course.

I know you and your crew have sought to "acquire" the Tribute in seasons past, but the Iron Rose has successfully deterred your efforts.

This season, I would invite you to make the attempt once again, with the assurance that the Iron Rose will not be on hand. 

In fact, you may find Guard Captain Dupont is very quick to surrender when you confront him on the road.

In exchange for your participation and your discretion, I will share the locations of the legendary Verdant Gemstones, that we might share in their bounty. 

Yours in good faith, and in confidence,
Francis Turner, Speaker of the Winds
The withering comes from the very earth here. The druids’ charge was to keep it at bay… but we failed.

We need that coin to buy a ship…
This land and the people who live here need that gemstone back where it belongs…
There’s gotta be at least some kinda reward, right…? Right?
Bah! So close! I was already feeling the sea spray on my face!

<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />Well met, newcomer. It's rare to see someone who's just arrived become such a pivotal figure in Corinth, but <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Nessa speaks very highly of you.

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />And with the situation in Windsward more dire than it's been in centuries, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />we will gladly accept your help. <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Are you here to talk about the location of the shrines?

"Yes. Have you learned anything?"

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Mostly just how little we truly know.<g id="litearmor_willcoverit" /> I've dedicated several lifetimes to studying Aeternum's history, but much of it remains a mystery.
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />Before we discuss the shrines, I should share what knowledge I have. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />You might even find it interesting…

<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />I believe you saw the Guardians yourself at Mirador, so you know the danger. <g id="litearmor_converseleft" />To learn the locations of the other shrines, we must venture again into the ruins.

<g id="litearmor_complimentplayer" />We're very fortunate you came to Aeternum when you did. <g id="litearmor_headtilthmm" />I have a feeling historians of the future will be studying records of your feats.

Please, everyone!

<g id="male_waghand03" priority="high"/>Before you counsel patience, I'd ask you to remember the atrocities <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />the Speaker and his conniving lackey have committed.

<g id="male_crossarmsUpset" priority="high" />See now, that Iron Rose thug wants to carve me up, but <g id="male_nodunderstand" />I'm just a soldier in this affair. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Everything I did, I was just following orders.
"What were the orders?"

<g id="female_explains" />Well, see here, ole Francis told me this tribute business with Medea was just a lie, <g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />made up so someone could steal from the good people of Corinth, <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />so that's why he cooked up this plan.

<g id="male_willcoverit" />My part was just to escort the damn tribute and surrender when the pirates attacked us.<g id="male_quidproquo" /> For doing that, I'd get half the take from one of them Gemstones.
"Who stole the Gemstones?"

<g id="female_nodyes" />The pirates. They wouldn't do this job for just a wagon-full of food and armaments. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />The deal was they get two Gemstones and we get the third.

<g id="male_spreadhands" />Look, if you'll keep your Iron Rose dog from biting me, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I'll even tell ya where you can find <g id="male_nodunderstand" />the Gemstone Francis and I was gonna split.
"It's a deal. Where?"

<g id="male_gestureup" priority="high"/>Right upstairs in the Speaker's stash. Now that I've told you that, you need to protect me from Francis, too. <g id="female_pointThreaten" />Don't forget our deal. Okay… okay?
<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />That Iron Rose bastard has violence in his eyes. Promise me you won't forget our deal… right? Right?

<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />Whatever that rat Dupont tells you, it isn't true. If anything, this is HIS fault. <g id="female_youknow" />Let's not forget he's the one who let the tribute get stolen.

<g id="female_whattheheck" priority="high"/>I don't know why you're so determined to bring me down… <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />snooping around my personal affairs? <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I'm Speaker of the Winds! <g id="female_pointThreaten" />I could have you arrested!
"I found the Gemstone."

<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />I've never seen that in all my days. Someone planted it there! <g id="male_dismissRegal" priority="high" />It's shameful, this conspiracy against me. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I'm the best Speaker this town's ever had.
"No, you're a liar and a traitor."

<g id="female_throwarmsFrustrated" priority="high" />Oh, and now you convict me without a trial! Before you plan the execution, <g id="female_youknow" />you'd do well to remember I have information you need. The other Gemstone, eh?

<g id="female_leanpointconvince" />It was the pirates all along, you know. Captain Dauti and Captain Korrapati. <g id="male_pointsoutthere" />They planned this, and when you find their Gemstones, that proves my innocence!
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />Go on and recover whatever Gemstones remain and we'll clean up all this business together, won't we? Hello? Are you listening to me?!
<g id="male_willcoverit" />You know, I'm sorry to intrude, but I could've sworn <g id="female_leanforwardListenNod" />I heard someone who wasn't necessarily telling the whole truth…
"He's all yours."
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Ah, the words I've so longed to hear. I'll… clean up here. <g id="male_compliment" />You have another Gemstone, you should go and deal with that. Godspeed, friend.

Um… <g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />you're not handing me over to HIM, are you...? This is not right! <g id="male_righthandAngry" />The people of Corinth will revolt if you take away their Speaker! You'll see!
<g id="male_waghand01" />You can't do this! The people of Corinth will revolt if you take away their Speaker! You'll see!
<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" />So the Speaker himself had the second gemstone. How did I not see that coming?
<g id="female_nodshrugokay" />Saves us some trouble, I suppose. We can just take it directly to one of the shrines. <g id="female_spreadarms" />Oh... What about the third gemstone?
"Captain Korrapati has it."
<g id="female_whattheheck" priority="high"/>Another pirate, then? Seems those are Francis Turner's <g id="g_male_headnodyes" />closest friends and confidants.

<g id="female_waveoffDisdain" />What's done is done. I shall no longer stand idly by while my work is scorned, broken, disrupted. <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />They shall soon see the terrible glory of my craft!

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Well enough. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Grace managed to keep Leovix distracted in the tavern long enough to get <g id="litearmor_gestureright" />Francis and Captain Dupont out of town.
Oh, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />and then everyone had to go and <g id="litearmor_handheart" />elect me as the new Speaker of the Winds.

<g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Thank you! I only hope <g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />we can move fast enough to ensure there's still a town worth speaking for.

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />As I mentioned, Grace has been a huge help, but she’s restless and leaving soon. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />She wanted to speak with you. <g id="litearmor_gestureleft" />Go on.

<g id="grace_welcome" />Well, look at you, breathing life back into this wee, sad town. <g id="grace_headnodyes" />You almost make me want to pitch in.

<g id="female_youknow" />Oh… a strategic thought - I'm no warrior, but <g id="male_pointBlame" />if you use the catwalks it could help you to keep the pirates from surrounding you. <g id="male_shrugBrief" />Your choice, though!

Seek out the Old Hermit\nfishing on the East River
"Why do you say that?"
<g id="grace_sorry" />There is a much greater battle brewing, one I can take no part in. But you… <g id="grace_convince1" />you are destined to play a role in it, for good or for evil.
<g id="grace_liftbothhands" />I sense within you a presence I am all too familiar with. Corruption has its<g id="grace_headshakeno" /> hooks in you and seeks to claim your soul.
"I hear its voice."
<g id="grace_yes" />Ah, the herald of Corruption herself. <g id="grace_handheart" />I will not speak her name, but know this, she will not relent until she has tormented you into madness.
<g id="grace_yes" />You must find some way to cleanse yourself of her influence, <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />or you will become Corrupted.
"What can I do?"

<g id="grace_secret" priority="high" />There's an old man fishing the river not far from here. His simpleminded demeanor belies<g id="grace_yes" /> great wisdom, particularly <g id="grace_convince1" />when it comes to Corruption.
<g id="grace_handheart" />As for me, I will bid you farewell… for now.

<g id="female_sympathyHandsheart" />I am so sorry to hear of your torment. You must do as Medea says and find this old man, <g id="female_nodyes" />and save yourself. Then, come and visit us in Corinth.
<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />There is nothing more for either of us here. Our destinies lie elsewhere, but we may cross paths again.
<g id="grace_handheart" />If I could help with your condition, I would, <g id="grace_headshakeno" />but it is beyond even my ability. It is a battle you must fight yourself.
<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />Just being near Medea, I can sense great and terrible magic. I must confess, I find it rather… enticing.
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" />After everything we've been through, I'm proud and honored to stand here today.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />If the town of Corinth pulls through this, it's thanks to you, comrade!

<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> The town of Corinth is finally at peace, though I'm nervous to say that out loud. <g id="male_complimentplayer" />There's a long road ahead, but we will be forever in your debt.
Supply Run
Craft tools, then gather and refine the materials requested by Taleas Serrano.

Equip a logging axe
Craft a {itemName} to help mine stone from boulders
Equip a mining pick

Everyone needs goods, don't they? <g id="sit_headshakeno" />Sadly, we have none to spare.
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />And it's not just food. Everyone eats, of course. But folks need timber, stone, and leather as well.
"This famine is bad, isn't it?"
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />Tell that to the annual tribute. <g id="sit_gestureleftM" />That last collection was a kick in the nethers.
<g id="sit_headshakeno" />Our stores have shriveled up like apples in winter. <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />And it's not exactly safe to go collect more, is it?
"What do you need the most?"
<g id="sit_gestureleftM" />Timber, cut stone, and leather. After all, folks need homes, clothes, and shoes. <g id="sit_nod" />We have a little food left but could always use more.
<g id="sit_shrugbrief" />Honestly, anything you could bring back would help. <g id="sit_dismissLeft" />Except dung. We got dung aplenty.
<g id="sit_headshakeno" />Our stores are as barren as a gravedigger's prospects.
Hey, look at this! <g id="sit_nod" />Something approaching an actual stockpile, I haven't seen that in months!
<g id="sit_headtilthmm" />Keep up the good work. We have other empty spots where goods should go.
<g id="sit_nod" />Thanks again, friend! We'll find a good use for everything you brought.
<g id="sit_nod" />We can strengthen our walls against the Lost. Folks will have new shoes to run away from horrors. <g id="sit_shrugbrief" />And the Speaker can finally get his escritoire!
A Town in Need
Check the Corinth Town Board to discover more ways to help Corinth prosper
Open up the Town Board to find more ways to help Corinth!
Fire Up the Forge
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge and bring it to Mason Zhang Haoyu in Corinth when you have completed your task.
Open Heavy Satchel from inventory to gain Iron Ore
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Use the Smelter
Use the Forge
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge
A new face? I haven't seen you around Corinth before.
I suppose it falls to me to tell you about our current troubles. Wouldn't want you to go around uninformed.
"About the tribute?"
There's trouble with the tribute? I hadn't heard that. I was talking about the Lost overrunning the farms.
Something happened out there. It's not safe to leave unless you know how to defend yourself.
"I know how to fight."
A solid start. But you should also learn how to make weapons. No blade lasts forever.
Here's some ore to get you started. Then, you should try to make an iron sword.
Open the satchel of ore I gave you, smelt it, then hammer out an iron sword.
Now, let's see your handiwork… impressive. Quite impressive. Either you've done this before, or you've got a knack for it.
We could use someone like you in Corinth, should you decide to stay.
With the Lost prowling, it's not safe to head outside the settlement's walls without protection.
Some youngsters have been demanding more weapons and armor to defend themselves, but… only a fool would arm anybody that green.
Just Dessert
Travel to Sweet Acre Farm to recover Kathrijn's Blueberry Compote and harvest Strawberries, Blueberries, Squash or Corn.
Travel to {POITags} to collect sweet treats
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Gather Strawberries, Blueberries, Squash, or Corn
Things are pretty dire, aren't they? We've got Swarmancers, we've got Lost, and people are starting to lose hope.
But I've got a plan to get everyone's spirits back up! You know what everyone loves?
"Security? Friends?"
No, dessert! Who could turn down some tasty treats?
No one, that's who! I have some ready and waiting back at the farm. I just can't get to them, it's too dangerous!
"I can go, if you like."
Of course you--wait, you really would? A nasty abomination is roaming the fields, and there are so many Withered!
I tried to go back once before, but I…just can't. I hate seeing my friends and family like that.
Those strawberries are going to go bad if you don't get to them soon! And who could resist some homemade blueberry compote!
You did it! You got the desserts! Oh, there will be a feast in Corinth tonight, I tell you! But first, how about we try a little here?
"What about dinner?"
What about it? Who needs dinner when you have dessert? A little sweetness goes a long way in times like these.
Pirates of Spice
Travel to the area around Buccaneer Creek and Mother's Tears to locate the missing spices.
Travel to Buccaneer Creek and Mother's Tears
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} Pirates
It's not just dessert that will make the settlement feel better.
After weeks of tough, dried meat that tastes like leather, everyone is sure to enjoy a meal full of robust flavor.
"And you have one…?"
I'm going to help make it! But first, I need something those pirates stole from me.
They've taken bags of my best spices! Honestly, I can't blame them, my spices do smell delicious. At least those soulless brutes have good taste.
"Apparently so."
Ha ha! I have my moments. Last I saw, they were heading to Buccaneer Creek and Mother’s Tears.
You can't miss the spices. Even if you miss the vibrant colors, you just have to follow your nose!
I need my saffron, pepper, and cardamom from the pirates at Mother’s Tears.
Sweet success! I can smell those spices from here! The fiery peppers, the rich scent of saffron, the warming aroma of cardamom.
I'll have to save some for another batch of desserts.
"What will you make?"
I'd love a good, hearty stew. But for starters, I'll make sure our dried meat is well seasoned!
These spices will put an end to any complaints about more salted wolf, for sure!
This island has all kinds of local plants just waiting to be used in cooking! Some of them are even edible. Hah.
Ha! Edible doesn't necessarily mean delicious, though. I'll have to try them out for new recipes.
Predator and Prey
Complete Tsui Fen's task to collect meat and fur from the Puma population in Eldergate then return to Tsui Fen's camp.
Travel to the Eldergate region to begin your hunt
Hunt {targetName} for {itemName}
Skin {targetName} for {itemName}
The Bear of Scratchrock
Hunt Pumas in the area and bring down the bear of Scratchrock Burrow. Report back to Tsui Fen when the task is complete.
Hunt Pumas and look for signs of the Bear's Victim
Follow trail of Bloodied Cloth to the Bear's Den
Follow trail of Bloodied Cloth to the Bear's Den
Follow trail of Bloodied Cloth to the Bear's Den
Follow trail of Bloodied Cloth to the Bear's Den
Follow trail of Bloodied Cloth to the Bear's Den
Enter the Burrow and Defeat {targetName}
<g id="male_bowShallow" />There is a serene little pond up here, a nice place to sit and meditate... <g id="male_shrugBrief" />as long as the pumas aren't prowling about.
<g id="male_handshipsdisapprove" />Beware if you go further - there's a very angry Bear. Many have been mauled by trespassing in its lair.
"Sounds dangerous."
<g id="female_liftHandsXs" />You look tough enough to help hunt pumas. They provide good food for the settlement, and hides for the tanner's guild.
"How many do you need?"
<g id="female_nodyes" />You'd be surprised at how much meat I can get out of one puma!
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Don't slaughter indiscriminately, we need the local population to be healthy. Just a few will do.
"What about the bear?"
<g id="male_shakehead" />Oh dear, oh dear. There was another death - the kind that people rarely return from.
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />Getting mauled by a bear is enough to make even the hardiest souls become Lost.
"Who died?"
<g id="male_shrugBrief" />Another hunter, Albrekt. He was doing the same thing you were, trying to get more food for everyone.
<g id="male_converseleft" />I imagine he got a bit too close to the bear den, but that's just speculation.
"I could hunt down the bear."
<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />You might want to bring a few friends.
<g id="male_shakehead" />I don't know where the lair is, so you'll have to track the bear down. I guess that means looking for… for whatever remains of poor Albrekt. Try looking near the lake.
<g id="male_shakehead" />This bear is unnaturally savage. It has plenty of natural prey, so it shouldn't keep mauling passersby.
<g id="female_takeItem8s" />Wonderful! This will make a pleasant change from all the wolf meat we've been eating. A little variety is good for morale.
"I defeated the Bear as well."
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Taking down that bear was no small feat. It's such a relief to hunt in the area, knowing it will be a while before the bear comes back.
<g id="male_shrugBrief" />Though I'm still going to avoid its den, and so should you. No sense tempting fate.
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Thanks again for helping out. We've got more reliable food now, thanks to you, and camping near the lake has been safer.
I just wish it hadn't been too late for Albrekt. I still haven't seen him return.
Brushed by Fate
Return Fude Hinode's set of brushes to her from where she left them at Eldergate.
Take the Fine Brush Set to Corinth
Find Fude Hinode at the Tavern
[A set of well maintained brushes rests here. Somone must have left them behind. There seems to be some vellum with them.]
"Looks like there's a label on them."
[If found, please return to the tavern in Corinth - signed F. Hinode.]
[The brushes are unlikely to make it back to the settlement without your help.]
My brushes! Thank you, thank you! I’ve painted so many places I forgot where I left them.
I tried searching, but as soon as I got anywhere, inspiration would strike and I’d be painting with my second-best set of brushes.
"Are those your easels out there?"
Not just mine. I'm part of a whole group of landscape painters on Aeternum.
You haven't lived until you've captured the clouds over the bay at sunset, or seen the sun peeking over the mountains at dawn.
This is wonderful! With my favorite set of brushes back in hand, I can paint better landscapes!
Where should I go next? North to Everfall for all that glorious foliage, or south to First Light and those impressive ruins?
Shot Across the Bow
Sabotage cannons and light striped powderkegs on fire at the pirate stronghold. Defeat Shamgar then return to Michael Lewis.
Travel to {POITags} to thwart the pirates
Sabotage cannons throughout {POITags}
Set fire to the Striped Powderkegs throughout {POITags}
Travel to {POITags} to thwart the pirates
Defeat {targetName}
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />I won't just watch Windsward go to hell. The Swarmancers, the Withered, the pirates… it's a damned mess, and we have to start somewhere.
<g id="male_shrugBrief" />Heard Francis was working with the pirates? Well, I know how to stop that.
"Then do tell."
<g id="female_youknow" />You know how the Swarmancers destroyed the farm? Ruined the windmills? Made it hard to get anything done?
<g id="male_nodunderstand" />Well, I plan on returning the favor to the pirates.
"Count me in."
<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />Already thought of that. We start by destroying the cannons. Those stockpiled powderkegs are just asking for a stray spark.
And there's a big, mean bruiser who leads their raids. <g id="male_clenchFistRight" />Bloody his nose, and they'll have a hard time retaliating.
Damn pirates, think they can go around raiding decent folk with impunity. Let's see how they like having their homes raided.
<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />That'll teach them! I could see those explosions from here! With any luck, that will bring us a spell of peace from the pirates.
<g id="female_nodyes" />My farm's lost, but it wasn't all for naught. I'm going to keep those pirates nice and bottled up in their little hideaway.
Warp and Weft
Collect Loom Patterns and Fabric Samples from Sirius and Stoneview Seabreak.
Travel to {POITags} to collect Loom Patterns
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} enemies
Travel to {POITags} to collect Fabric Samples
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} enemies
I know you're aware of our supply shortages here in Windsward. I've even heard you helped restock our food and wood stores, and for that you have my profound thanks.
But we are running dangerously low on clothing.
"What about crafting more?"
Oh let me tell you. Crafting takes time, and my method would be a bit faster.
Ha ha ha! I propose we go in and steal the pants off of those ancient guardians. Well, perhaps not exactly pants, as they don't seem to wear pants, but you get the idea.
"Anything else you need?"
Hmm… Since you asked, any loom patterns you find will help immensely!
I'll be able to get our production up and running with the new patterns without having to come up with the designs myself. That will save so much time!
Every second you stay here is another thread frayed, another shirt torn, another cloth dirtied.
Oh. My thanks! How utterly divine! Look at this cloth! It has withstood the centuries and yet looks freshly made.
Oh. If only I knew the secrets of those ancient dyes… Such vibrant colors, they’re even more impressive up close!
"Do you need dyes?"
Oh you are a dear, but not yet. First I need to get these to the people of Corinth.
Once the settlement is reclothed, then perhaps then I'll have time to pursue my studies into ancient dyes.
The Ancients had such wonderful garments, such fantastic cloth, such marvelous dyes.
My dream is to recreate those stunning fashions and make them into modern sensations.
Towering Tools
Collect any remaining tools of the Ancients from Fallswatch Overlook and Mirador, then return to Antiquarian Pajitnova in Windsward.
Investigate {POITags} for any remaining tools of the Ancients
Collect {itemName}
Investigate {POITags} for any remaining tools of the Ancients
Collect {itemName}
Oh dear, you spooked me! Needless to say, I'm a little nervous wandering around out here on my own.
I must complete my collection, however, whatever risk it requires.
"What collection?"
Oh, well, I am an Antiquarian. Yelena Pajitnova. Nice to... meet you.
I collect tools used by the Ancients - construction tools - whatever they used to build these magnificent towers. Only, I've met some resistance.
"I can help if you like."
Oh, would you? Those Guardians are... well... pesky. So I'd reward you handsomely.
Any tools you can recover, I'm most interested in those two sites. Oh, and thank you in advance!
This view is magnificent, isn't it? How they built such wonders is beyond me. If you'll recover any tools you can find, I might have a better idea.
You have a gleam in your eye... you've found something? Let me see!
Yes, these are precisely the types of things I'm looking for. The Ancients did not share our methods of construction at all.
"Any idea what methods they used?"
The items you helped add to my collection suggest multiple possibilities for the Ancients' construction methods.
Do return some time and we shall explore these matters further.
Taken to Task
Defeat Kisare the Taskmaster to acquire the Taskmaster's Heart. Then report back to Antiquarian Pajitnova in Windsward.
Travel to {POITags} to locate the Taskmaster's Heart
Defeat {targetName} Guardians
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
It's clear they were capable of harnessing some type of energy to aid in their construction.
But I believe there was some labor involved as well.
"What kind of labor?"
The kind you do with your hands. The funny thing is that we still don't even know what the Ancients look like.
Two hands? Four hands? No hands? But I believe it was not the Ancients themselves who did the work.
"Who did the work?"
It's not clear, but probably some type of thralls who served the Ancients.
In Amrine Temple, I've heard speak of an "Ancient Taskmaster." If you can defeat it and bring me a piece of it, that would be an interesting find.
Whatever elements you can recover from the corpse of the Taskmaster would be of greatest interest to me.
Did you defeat the Taskmaster? Amazing! Let me see what you found…
Yes, the very heart of this being, clearly not biological, but was he once human? This is the perfect addition to my collection! Thank you!
Seeing Clearly (Expedition)
Collect the Antiquarian's Eyepiece from Simon Grey in Amrine Excavation for Antiquarian Pajitnova in Windsward.
Venture Into {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName}
Well now, I'm almost starting to think of you as an old friend.
Don't go disappearing on me, now. I'm still mourning the loss of my best friend and former colleague.
"Who are you talking about?"
Simon. Simon Grey, one of the most brilliant researchers on Aeternum.
He disappeared some time ago in the Amrine Excavation. It's sad for many reasons. Especially for the loss of his equipment.
"His equipment?"
Yes. Simon carried the legendary "Antiquarian's Eyepiece", allowing the wearer to inspect the smallest of details.
In fact, if you were to find such a thing in the Excavation, I'd reward you handsomely for it.
You must think me callous, wanting Simon's Eyepiece, but I have already mourned Simon's loss.
So it's true then? Simon Grey became Lost, his soul never able to be repaired. Very sad.
His research was groundbreaking, and I will use the Antiquarian's Eyepiece to honor his legacy. Thank you.
The Eyepiece is even more useful than I remembered. Thank you for retrieving it.
Seeds of Steel
Find and read the creed of the Iron Rose.
Commander Merrill dives under the minotaur's blade, dodges left, weaves right, and plunges his sword into the heart of the beast!
Oh, sorry. I didn't notice someone was near. I was… training.
"Training for what?"
To join the Iron Rose Company. Stalwart bastions of valor they are. I don't have a copy of the creed.
You look like a hardy adventurer. Could you swing by their camp and borrow a copy for me?
"Of course."
Thank you! I've seen it posted near their encampments. May be multiple pages.
I know I'll have to meditate and learn discipline, but that's difficult without instruction.
I know all the Iron Rose mercenaries. Commander Merrill, Captain Leovix Silva, Cotheran the Red, Gideon Sturm!
You're back! I had heard that many of them became Lost. I was worried about you.
"I found the creed for you."
Thank you so much! I'll study this and memorize it. Someone has to carry on their legacy.
I'll make myself worthy of the name. With study and dedication, one day I'll be worthy.
Venture to {POITags} and find the creed
Collect "The Iron Creed"
A Garden of Iron
Obtain an Iron Rose Sword for Roya.
The creed says valor is a beacon to those who've lost hope. Let your blade shine a light in the dark….
"Sounds noble enough."
I agree. Problem is, I don't have a sword. And Iron Rose soldiers ought to have an Iron Rose blade.
They are very specific weapons. Can't be crafted by just any old smith.
"I could get you one."
That'd be marvelous! I've hit enough sticks against tree trunks, I swear the forest is starting to glare at me.
I hear Iron Rose swords are weighted differently than most. Their center of gravity is oddly located, increasing thrusting power.
A warrior is no more noble or sharp than the iron of the blade he carries. No more graceful than the way he treats others.
"I have your sword."
Oh thank you, thank you! You truly are a friend. I'll be able to practice properly now. Trees beware!
Visit {POITags} to find a sword for Roya
Defeat {targetName}
Recover Iron Rose Sword from Weapon Rack
Oh thank you, thank you! You truly are a friend. I'll be able to practice properly now. Trees beware!
By Any Other Name
Deliver Roya's application to the missing mercenary.
It's all been for nothing. All my training. My research into the Iron Rose... There's no chance of me becoming one of their ranks now.
"What's gone wrong?"
I wrote an application letter and took it to Captain Silva. But he's head of the townsguard now.
He doesn't want anything to do with the Iron Rose.
"What will you do?"
I heard a rumor of a man wandering out east wearing their colors. But who knows where he is or if he'll listen.
It's time I face reality and sought a real trade. I could become a baker, I suppose. Pies are delicious.
"I'll find him. Give me the letter."
I doubt he is even alive anymore. Likely he's Lost like the others. But if you want to try, I won't stop you. Here, take it.
Thank you for all you have done for me. Perhaps it's time I embrace the path of all great bakers like… uh… I can't think of any to be honest with you.
Deliver the letter to {destinationName}
Thank you for delivering my letter to Gideon. He told me he will consider my application.
His response seemed promising. In the meanwhile I'll continue practicing the stances.
Darkness. Death. A baleful curse. That's all that is left of our order. Company of Lies and Ashes is more like it.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I dreamt of defending the countryside with my comrades in arms. But they've all fallen now…
"Valor is a beacon"
<g id="male_shocked" />Those words! That's our creed. How do you know those words?
"I met an aspirant to your order."
<g id="female_thinking" />An application to join the order… She's been training, and she speaks with discipline. There may be hope for the Iron Rose yet.
<g id="female_nodyes" />I will take her on as my page. Teach her our ways. Thank you, my friend!
<g id="male_willcoverit" />When I joined the Iron Rose, I swore to bring beauty and peace to the land with the aid of my sword.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You have restored that hope in me. I am eternally grateful for your service.
This Mortal Sphere
A group of archeologists have gone missing near an ancient tomb. Follow their trail and discover what has happened then report back to Elric Chapman.
What is in the spheres? A weapon? A treasure? Something more sinister?
The excavation crew should have found out by now. Where have they gone?
"What spheres?"
Pardon me, I was mostly thinking aloud. Just north of here there's an ancient tomb with strange spheres around it.
We sent a team of antiquarians to investigate but they have yet to return.
"I can go find them for you."
I would greatly appreciate that. But be cautious, the Ancients wielded powers we don't fully yet understand.
My team are rigorous note takers. If you discover any of their journals, please collect them. Best of luck!
No luck yet? Oh dear. Could be they are lost to time - just like my mother's affection. Buried under sand and dust…
You've survived! I was beginning to worry. What did you find?
"They've all become Lost."
I… I had feared that may have happened. Thank you for your efforts. I'll inform their families.
The secrets of Aeternum yet elude me. But still, I feel as if we are on the verge of a breakthrough.
Read the journal entry 'The Dig Site: Day 1'
Read the journal entry 'Misfortune'
Read the journal entry 'Excavation: Day 15'
Explore {POITags} and Search for the Missing Antiquarians
Creation Myths
Elric has some interesting theories about the spheres. Follow his instructions and set them in place. Then report your findings back to him.
There you are! I've been looking for you. I have a theory. My mother thinks it's hogwash, but I believe it to hold promise.
"What is it?"
The spheres seem to store power. I believe that if you infuse them with enough azoth, they should be able to interact with other spheres nearby.
You'll have to find one that's more well preserved than those at the tomb.
"Okay. Where should I look?"
I'd recommend Amrine Temple. Its architecture dates back to the same period as the tomb, but the spheres there are in better condition.
We'll discover the secrets of the Ancients, you and I. That'll prove my worth. Maybe then my mother will say something nice to me.
You've returned! Were you able to get a reaction from the spheres?
"It conjured a random item."
Hmm… Curious… I've been hypothesizing that the spheres were either a tool of creation or transportation from the Ancients.
I'm not sure what determines what is conjured. I wonder if that's how the buffalo got to this island…?
Curious… I've been hypothesizing that the spheres were either a tool of creation or transportation from the Ancients.
I'm not sure what determines what is conjured. I wonder if that's how the buffalo got to this island…?
Thank you for your aid, my friend. I worry that my colleagues will laugh at my findings unless I get firm evidence. So I will continue the search.
Fallen Towers, Forgotten Notes
Return the missing journal to its owner.
Take the Tower Journal to Corinth
Find Moira Chapman in Corinth
The journal looks like a trove of knowledge. It's certainly massive enough.
After flipping through the pages, you find an address inked inside the back cover.
"This belongs to Moira Chapman."
The journal looks too important to just leave exposed to the elements like this.
The journal manages to somehow look forlorn.
<g id="litearmor_handheart" />Oh my goodness! Is that my journal! I'm impressed, it's a huge undertaking to carry that around!
"It's not light."
<g id="litearmor_youknow" />But the knowledge inside, it is invaluable! It has all my notes on the towers of Windsward.
<g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Did you know that there have been other studies of the towers, and they have gone missing? I can't thank you enough for bringing it back to me.
Zoology 101
Margot is researching strange things in Aeternum. She wants to know why there are Buffalo here. Investigate the area and gather samples and any notes you find regarding them.
Aeternum is a new land full of strange beasts. New paths that need charting. There is so little we understand. Like the Buffalo.
<g id="male_shakehead" />They just don't make any sense. There must be an answer to the question of them.
"You're talking about the buffalo."
<g id="female_nodyes" /> They are a species from a completely different part of the world from all others on Aeternum. There must be a reason.
<g id="female_spreadarms" />If you head out to the west of Windsward you will find a herd of them. Collect what you can and bring it back.
"I can do that."
<g id="male_bowShallow" />You have my gratitude. It's unlikely that they fell here out of the sky. I'm sure they are just as confused as I am about the whole ordeal.
<g id="female_thinking" />Haven't discovered anything yet? That's okay. Take your time. The wonders of the world unfurl slowly in our fragile hands.
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />What have you uncovered about our furry friends?
"The spheres seem to be involved."

<g id="female_thinking" />Interesting. I'll have to chat with Elric. I believe he has been researching those. There is so much to uncover about this strange and bounteous land. Its mysteries entrance me.
A Wyrd and Wonderful World
Margot has discovered a plant that seems to have strange properties. Gather sprigs of it and present them to people around Windsward to see what their reactions are.

<g id="female_spreadarms" />When was the last time you truly stood in wonder of the world? There is glory in the morning dew. The sun's kiss on our cheeks is more warm and gentle than any lover's lips.
"You seem happy."
<g id="female_nodshrugokay" />More people around here would be if they glimpsed the glory of Wyrdwood trees. Their beauty is trascendent.
<g id="female_explains" />If you find someone who is down, take them a Wyrdwood sapling. They contain the sparkle of starlight in their branches.
"I'll give it a shot."
<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />They mirror the viewer's intent. If you pause and appreciate them with true wonder, they'll shimmer the lights of heaven back at you.
<g id="female_nodyes" />They will hold your intent and reflect it in response so others may feel that same awe in kind.
<g id="male_shrugBrief" />Wonder is a clandestine thing. It seldom shows its face to those who are in a hurry.
Every day is the same. The same walls over and over. The same woes. There is no splendor.
I want to feel excited by life again, but everything has lost its color.
"There is splendor in the flora."
What is this… it's… remarkable. The light in the branches, see how they shimmer. Has the sky always been so gorgeous?
I couldn't tend to such a marvel. But perhaps you could. Here, take this pot. Keep it thriving forever.
Look at the green of the trees, the azure glory of the river. There is such beauty in the hues of the world.
Where has my zeal gone? I used to be thrilled to tend the crops, to share my food with others, but now it feels empty.
Seems like I've seen all there is to see. Done all there is to do.
"I find zeal in wyrdwoods."
The light in the stem, it looks like it's dancing. Oh, is it responding to my voice? That's cheeky.
I couldn't take this from you, but you should keep such a wonder safe. Take this.
I walk lighter because of you. There is a pep in these old bones. I am blessed to be alive in this land of marvels.
I've spelunked caverns of the ancients, crossed the sands of Brimstone by foot, and yet the world is still closed to me. I've found no answers. Only more questions.
What is the point of searching anymore? To what end?
"Let nature be your answer."
Ew. What odd flora. It appears to be calling out to me. I… I've forgotten to be present for nature's beauty.
Thank you, kind traveller. Take this as a token of my appreciation. Keep your light shining.
There is more yet to be seen. Not documented and researched, but lived. The eyes do not tire so long as they glimpse the horizon and yearn for tomorrow.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />I see smiles on faces that were once dour because of you. To know that even one person breathes easier because of us is to have suceeded.
<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" />I hope you remember that whenever you look on the potted saplings. That is true magic.
"It's being present. Being kind."
<g id="female_nodding" />That's exactly right! Gods be damned - to be present for another human being is to share in their divinity. To be kind is to perform miracles.
<g id="female_spreadarms" />There are countless wonders in nature. Be it the song of the wind too perfect for words, or the laughter of the creek babbling on eternally.
<g id="male_explain" />Stop and be moved by nature. If you do, it will move through you and bring peace to others.
For years, people doubted me, insulted me. But now they look up to me, for I am a Marauder.
You think you are the stuff of Marauders? Do not underestimate us. Our path demands sacrifice.
I think you have a physique for the Syndicate and a will for the Covenant. Perhaps you should visit them.
Dare you believe yourself worthy of the Marauders? Are you bold only of tongue or can you support that with action?
Long ago, I considered joining the Syndicate. But then I realized that I have a spine.
The Covenant’s folly will always be their desire to help others before themselves. I stand strong on my own two feet.
My initiation into the Marauders was the pivotal moment of my life. Now, accept this challenge to complete yours.
Now that you have officially joined our ranks, we expect you to seize every opportunity to gain honor.
Missions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
My blade, my life. Choose your next contribution to our cause.
Glad tidings to you, friend. Lend me an ear and I'll weave you a yarn.
So you seek an audience with yours truly? What subject do you fancy?
Astrology, numerology, alchemy, or any of the other sciences for that matter.
I have quite the thirst for a cold brew from Cormack's place. Don't let my size fool you, I can hold my fill.
But I digress. Why not take a moment to visit the other faction leaders. See what they're missing.
The look on that distinctive face of yours tells me you've made a decision. Hold me in suspense no longer. Out with it!
One day, perhaps we'll raise a glass together. But not if you keep spoiling the land around here -- Cormack can't get enough hops!
I’ve yet to meet a Templar that made a good drinking buddy, maybe you’ll be the first.
Welcome into the fold. We'll uncork a bottle later, but we have work to do first.
Now that you have officially joined in our enterprise, you should always seek ways to advance our interests.
Missions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
Glad to cast eyes upon you again, friend. Have you returned for more adventure?
Of what ilk are you stranger? Care to better Aeternum?
Glad tae meet ye. What can I do for you?
Before you get too far here, go visit those other dobbers. Then come back here and we'll have a blether.
Have you returned to pledge yer life to bearing the light? Gaun yersel.
Your head’s full of mince, Marauder. Go pillage elsewhere.
I’ve seen you skulking around town collecting whispers. You’ll get nothing from me.
Ya’ve made a good move friend. We are stronger together.
Now that you have joined in our cause, you must carry the light into the world at every chance.
Missions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
I see the light is still with ye.
Give a sprig to Ahura
Give a sprig to Priya
Give a sprig to Utkarsh
Read "The Baffling Buffalo"
Read "A Close Encounter"
Read "The Song of the Spheres"
Go to {POITags} and search for info on the buffalo

Whine, whine…
Woof!
Bark, bark! (Barkimedes looks happy to see you.)

Bones For Barkimedes (Expedition)
Simon Grey's dog Barkimedes is awaiting his master's return and is very hungry. From what you can tell he would appreciate having some Ravager bones to gnaw on.
"What's wrong, boy?"
Sniff, sniff… Ruff! (Barkimedes sounds like he's hungry.)
"Would you like some bones, boy?"
Bark, bark! (Barkimedes sounds pleased at the offer.)
(Barkimedes is panting eagerly, waiting for the bones.)
Woof! (Barkimedes excitedly takes the bones… and promptly buries them.)
Venture into the Amrine Excavation Expedition
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
More Bones for Barkimedes (Expedition)
Simon Grey's dog Barkimedes wants an enhanced bone-chewing experience from the Enchanted Bones of the Shattered Obelisk expedition.
"Hey boy, want some special bones?"
Ruff, ruff! (Barkimedes' eyes go wide in anticipation and his tail wags.)
"I can get bones from the Barrows."
(Barkimedes lets out an excited howl.)
(Barkimedes is panting eagerly, waiting for the special bones.)
Woof, woof! (Barkimedes chews on the bones ravenously.)

Defeat {targetName} for an {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} for a {itemName}
