Salvage an {itemName}
Catch a Clam in Salt Water
Salvage a {itemName}
Whatever you do, don't go near First Light! The plants came to life and took over!
I lived in the settlement there… well, ever since I can remember, but now, I'll never go back!
"What happened in First Light?"
Nature's fury - that's what happened! The Angry Earth's done claimed the territory!
And not any Angry Earth like you've seen before - walking plants, vicious beasts… there's was even a damned Gorgon!
"Slow down. Tell me the story."
Well, it was a rainy day and I was just coming back from gathering some truffles, when I saw that Huntress… Abriana? Is that her name?
She wasn't happy - told me the Angry Earth was coming and I should run.
"So did you do what she said?"
Not right away, but I did make sure I'd be ready… suppose that's why I'm the only one who made it.
The others… Magistrate Bond was attacked by this abomination! A plant and a rat all mixed up!
"What did it do to her?"
It tore her up to pieces! I never seen anything like it, and then whatever was left got put in this plant pod.
The plants were coming up from the ground, over the walls. I just ran and I didn't stop until I got here.
"What else did you see?"
It was dark and I was running, so not much. There was a horn and drums… and snarling monstrous beasts at my heels.
Then I saw that Gorgon - snakes for hair, and I just closed my eyes!
"Can you tell me anything else?"
Nah, there's a bramble wall done grown up at the edge of the territory… no one's getting in or out now.
I'm not going back anyways… I just want to forget it before it drives me Lost. In fact, I think that's all I'm going to say.
See here now, you gotta have mercy! Don't make me relive it again.
I'm just going to try to forget First Light ever existed… it's the best thing for all of us. And once I get my wits, I'm finding a tavern!
Heh. This place isn't as bright as the name suggests. Want to survive? Keep your guard up like the knights of yore did. I can help you.
"How would you do that?"
The ghosts whisper to the cloth through me. We make the fabric do our bidding.
Aha! You seem fierce in fashion and forward in battle. I, Gianni, can help you impress the ladies and depress your foes!
I've added wefts in the cloth, an art I learnt in Africa. Can you see the pattern or is it too fine? I outdo myself sometimes.
Use the fog to your advantage, tomodachi. I could create an outfit for you, that stands out and blends in. Just ask.
Ha! I craft my own indigo with Azoth and a plant I shall not name.
Old world indigo can give you flame resistance. Matsukura's indigo can give you any power you choose.
Windsward is a classic example of a wasted land. Such potential and such little hemp.
Guard your good clothes. And I can enhance them, if you'd like.
Well, I couldn't depend on hemp, so I began making thread out of Azoth.
Stitching it into a cloth using the Patola technique gives it magical powers.
Did you know you can win battles even before stepping onto the field?
Study your enemy's weaknesses, tell me the strengths you need and I will give you robes for victory.
I soak the hemp in Azoth before stitching it into the fabric. There are a few more steps, but no wise person gives all their secrets away.
The dragon stuns its opponents with its beauty.
You too, can make your opponents tremble with your grace. Choose your outfit and I will give it power.
I prefer keeping my techniques to myself.
My brother may be more forthcoming. He's so proud of finally succeeding, he can't contain himself.
Not even the ghosts of smiles wander the desolate paths of this forsaken land.
IF you wish to survive, I can make your garments sturdy.
How do I do it? How does anyone do it?
I must have known at one time. But sadness erodes everything, even the memories I once held precious.
Ever wonder why they say 'knight in shining armor'? They could have said 'knight in broken armor', 'knight with rusted sword'.
No, to be a hero, you've got to dress like one. Let me help you.
A true diva never reveals their secrets, honey. Especially to strangers, no matter how cute the strangers are.
Visit me more and then maybe I'll tell you how I do this.
The Weavers believe they're the best thing that happened to cloth after weaving was invented.
Sure, they can stitch a flawless seam. But can they grant an outfit magical powers like I can?
I don't do it. My pet weaverbirds do. Poor things dipped their beaks in Azoth a while ago. But it gave them magical powers.
And no, I'm not going to show you the birds! I don't let the babies out of my house!!
Hmmm. Ever fancied yerself a pirate? A guy I know used to tie dynamite sticks to his beard to scare people off.
A bit extreme and I don't do hair. But I can create a very special, highly magical garment for you.
The Goddess of the Sea showed me how to do this.
I slept a while in her fragrant lap and she whispered the words to me. When I woke up, I could transform the cloth I wore.
An adventurer with style? For a moment, I thought you were a mirage.
Let's preserve your flair and your face. Come to me when you find an outfit you love. I'll give it the powers you need.
My mother taught me the ancient art of Al Sadu. We make simple weaves with natural materials back home.
But, when I applied those same techniques here, I was able to transform cloth entirely.
You haven't a chance in hell of surviving with the garb you have on. The geists will electrocute you and the turkeys will feed on your parts.
Listen to me. Let me transform your clothes for you.
Greek weavers know the beauty of a cloth is in its material.
I create threads with plants which exude lightning. I then embroider motifs into the fabric with these threads.
We must do everything in our power to crush Corruption and increase our morale.
When you dress well, it's not only for yourself, it's for the friend you're fighting next to. And I can help you with that.
I will tell you. But after the war. Right now, focus on how to strike our enemy.
Have you heard music soothes the savage beast? So does style. I can help you sing the Angry Earth a sweet lullaby.
Mon cherie, breathe in the nature around you. How could one not be inspired to do more?
I found my calling in the magic of the thread. Now, it's your turn to surprise us.
Fishing With Shields
Collect Woodlouse bait by gathering bushes for Master Fisher Shields. Talk to Master Fisher Shields in Windsward.
"Hello, I'm {playerName}."
Ah! Ahoy there, {playerName}! Before you get to the adventure and glory, you'll need to learn how to fill your belly with the bounty of the sea.
First, you'll need some bait.
"Where do I get bait?"
Some of the most readily available bait are Woodlice, creepy crawly creatures that reside inside of bushes. The rest you can get through various other means.
Have you found any Woodlice yet? If you look through the splintered remains of the bushes you've gathered you should be able to spot a few of the buggers. Come back to me when you have five of them.
Woodlice draw in larger fish, and believe you me, size matters. Beside that, though, there's still some more basics I want to impart to you, skipper.
Gather bushes to collect {itemName}
Fishing Basics
Cast, hook, and reel in three fish for Master Fisher Shields and deliver them to Master Fisher Ruby in Everfall.
"What should I do next?"

Let's get in on the action now! Fishing involves three basic steps: casting, hooking, and reeling the sucker in. It may take some getting used to but once you get into the pattern you can go for hours nonstop.
"What should I do after that?"
If you can catch three fish, take 'em and go show Ruby in Everfall what ole Shields taught you.
Master Fisher Ruby up in Everfall will appreciate seeing a fresh face to train. She's a real eager one, and has a lot of natural talent.
You caught these fish yourself? Shields was right to send you in my direction to continue your training. I've got so much to teach you!
Equip your Fishing Pole
Cast your Fishing Pole
Hook fish
Reel in fish
Baited
Catch one Snail in Fresh Water and one Clam in Salt Water to salvage them for bait for Master Fisher Ruby and deliver them to Master Fisher Clemenson in Monarch's Bluff.
"Yes. Master Fisher Shields sent me to you."
In fresh water the more common baits you can acquire are Snails and in ocean water, Clams.
My colleague in Elysian Wilds, Master Fisher Clemenson, would greatly appreciate this ocean water bait being delivered to her.
"Why am I fishing for a Master Fisher?"
Don't tell her I said this, but she's been having some trouble getting bites lately.
Master Fisher Clemenson can be a bit rough around the edges but I consider her one of my closest allies in this strange land.
Did Ruby put you up to this? Bah! I don't know why she thinks I need the help...
Don't get too cocky just because you got some bait.
Catch a Snail in Fresh Water and salvage it to create {itemName}
Catch a Clam in Salt Water and salvage it to create {itemName}
Hotspot Hunt
Catch fish from a Hotspot three times for Master Fisher Clemenson and deliver a note to Master Fisher Warwick in Monarch's Bluff.
"What can you teach me?"
Here's a lesson: Have you ever seen a spot in the water that looks like it would be prime for fishing? These are called Hotspots.
Try your luck in these Hotspots and then take this.
"What's this?"
It's a message from me to Master Fisher Warwick. It is imperative that you do not open this note!
Having trouble finding Hotspots? Look along the coast or at inland lakes and rivers. Hotspots can be found in any kind of water and anywhere.
A note from Master Fisher Clemenson? Please, put it down right there. No, my hands are too dirty to touch it right now, but... thank you.
Catch fish from (Active) Hotspots
Practice Makes Perfect
Catch fifteen fish anywhere for Master Fisher Warwick and deliver to Master Fisher Perchal in Cutlass Keys.
"I have something for you."
The best training is hard, focused doing. You've fished up some bait and a few meager samplings of fish, but I want you to fully commit to catching fifteen fish.
"What should I do with all these fish?"
Master Fisher Perchal can be distracted easily, and forgets to eat. Take your fish to her and she will be grateful.
Don't give up now, recruit! Er, I mean, student!Catch fifteen fish for Master Fisher Perchal. She needs to eat!
Aha! Did you see that? I just fished up my biggest yet!...What's that? Oh, fish for food rations? I am a bit peckish.
Catch fish anywhere
The Giant Ones
Catch eight fish greater than 20 inches in length for Master Fisher Perchal and deliver it to Master Fisher Park in Brightwood.
"How do fishing and alchemy mix?"
The bait, of course! What's your biggest catch so far?
Catch eight fish longer than 20 inches, and bring them to Master Fisher Park up in Brightwood. She's a fisherwoman and an alchemist, and she's been experimenting with new bait types.
"New bait types?"
Yes, she's researching what bait can reel in the longest fish, so remember to tell her what you used!
Remember, Clams and Oysters in fresh water and Snails and Electric Eels in salt water increase the likelihood of reeling in a bigger fish.
Multiply by three, carry the one... Woah!
What's that you've got? What a specimen! I've been studying fish lengths in relation to their weights and this one fits right in with my findings.
Catch eight fish with a length greater than 20 inches
Fish Reagents
Collect one Squid Ink and one Catfish Whisker after salvaging Squid and Catfish for Master Fisher Park and deliver them to Master Fisher Agarwal in Weaver's Fen.
"Can you teach me about fishing and alchemy?"
Various fish, when properly salvaged, have parts that can be used in Alchemy.
The whiskers of the Catfish and the ink of the Squid most particularly. Could you collect some and present them to Agarwal in Weaver's Fen?
"Why does she need them?"
Everything on this island thrums with the power of azoth, the fish included.
Making use of all parts of water creatures is both responsible and pragmatic.
Alchemy in Aeternum is a delicate science that often relies upon elemental reagents. Fishing can help acquire them.
A new way to salvage Catfish and Squids? Why, this is brilliant news! Thank you for coming all this way to inform me of Park's findings.
Catch a Hooked Squid
Catch a Barbed Catfish
Salvage a Hooked Squid for {itemName}
Salvage a Barbed Catfish for {itemName}
Reel Life
Catch three Slimy Boots in Weaver's Fen to clean up the waters for Master Fisher Agarwal and deliver a new line to Master Fisher O'Connor in Restless Shore.
"What kind of fish are abundant in the Fen?"
Shoes are most often lost to the swamp's pull, and if you could fish up five Boots that would at least be a start in helping clean up the pollution in the area.
"What should I do when I'm done?"
Once you've helped clean up the Fen, go see Master Fisher O'Connor. They're a spritely one and will likely have a grander task for you.
Five boots, out of the water, and then visit Master Fisher O'Connor. Good luck!
I love to fish more than I love to fight nowadays, though I still do a fair bit of the latter.
Catch {itemName} in Weaver's Fen
Weapons of the Sea
Catch a Fish Sword and a Fish Head Hammer for Master Fisher O'Connor and present them to Master Fisher Abebe in Mourningdale.
"Agarwal said you had something for me."
The Fish Sword and the Fish Head Hammer are folk legends here - said to have been lost in these waters, long ago.
They're certainly rare finds. So rare that Fishing Master Abebe doesn't believe me when I say they're out there and itching for a hand to wield them once more.
"Why won't he believe you?"
I may have dashed my credibility by talking about sea monsters in the Restless Shore.
But I stand by both my sea monster sighting and the existence of these weapons, though.

While perhaps not the mightiest weapons, the Fish Sword and Fish Head Hammer sure are great conversation starters! 'Where'd you get such a nautical weapon?', people will ask, and you can reply: 'I fished it up myself!'
Hail, adventurer. I'm guessing O'Connor sent you my way to settle another one of our disputes... By Jove! Actual weapons fished from the water!
Catch a {itemName}
Catch a {itemName}
Treasures of the Deep
Catch a Treasure Chest for Master Fisher Abebe and present it to Master Fisher Klaus in Great Cleave.
"What can you teach me?"
In this land where rain pours eternal, there are many opportunities for fishing. There is something of greater value than the fish themselves lurking in the depths, though: Treasure chests.
"What do these chests contain?"
Coins, jewels, and all kinds of precious artifacts.
Take your findings to Master Fisher Klaus in Great Cleave to remind him there's more to life than helping the Soulwardens.
The coin is appreciated, but it is the transformative properties of azoth here that I believe make the fish of Aeternum more intelligent.
Hello there. Master Fisher Klaus at your service. You've got to be strong to take on the fish in these parts.
They learn to fight in these cold mountain waters, and you have to be ready for them.
Catch a Treasure Chest
Soulwarden Rations
Catch five fish heavier than 30 pounds for Master Fisher Klaus and deliver them to Master Fisher Davies in Edengrove
"He's doing well."
The Soulwardens are hearty eaters, and need large fish to supply their rations with.
Could you catch five large fish and deliver them to Master Fisher Davies? We both oversee the supply of food for the Soulwardens.
"Why provide food to the Soulwardens?"

You would be hungry if you were fighting Corruption the way the Soulwardens do, too. Even though we don't need food to survive on this island it certainly is one way to keep from going insane and losing track of time.
I mark my days with three square meals, mostly fish, of course.
Aye, that's it… Come to Papa wee little fishes… oh! I didn't see you there. Singing while I fish calms me.
You've come with the loot of a lifetime for the hungry Soulwardens here.
Catch an {itemName}
Azoth-Tinged Fish
Catch an Azoth-Tinged Fish in Shattered Mountain and deliver it to Master Fisher Bernard.
"What else is in the water besides fish?"
There are mythical creatures as well, like The Azoth Tinged Fish.
"What's an Azoth Tinged Fish?"
A fish whose entire essence has been possessed and imbued with the magical powers of azoth, of course! Catch one for Bernard in Shattered Mountain.
Don't be discouraged if you haven't yet caught an Azoth Tinged fish, those things are slippery and ephemeral at best.
Ah, I assume you're the new fisher who Master Fisher Davies has sent my way? That is a strange fish you carry there.
Catch fish with a weight greater than 30 pounds
Corruption-Tinged Fish
Catch a Corruption-Tinged Fish in Shattered Mountain and bring it to Master Fisher Chang in Ebonscale.
"Hello, Bernard. Anything else you need?"
Yes. Help me prove something to my fellow Master Fishers.
Like the land here, the waters are tainted by Corruption. I believe the fish are affected, as well.
"Is this like an Azoth-Tinged Fish?"
Yes, I suppose so. Interesting observation. But indeed, catch a Corruption-Tinged Fish and bring it to Master Fisher Chang in Ebonscale - he likely can find the same thing there.
If Corruption seeps down the mountain and into the southern settlements, then all the fish in Aeternum will be affected.
What is that you bring with you, traveler? It reeks of Corruption... Mercy me, is that supposed to be a fish?
Master Fisher Bernard was right to send you my way.
Catch a {itemName}
Ecological Report
Obtain various levels of fish fillet for Master Fisher Chang in Ebonscale to assess the health of the island's underwater denizens.
"How are the fish of this area?"
I want to do a survey of the fish in other areas to make sure they haven't progressed like the one you brought from Shattered Mountain.
Help me with this and I will recommend you to the Grand Master Fisher, Gaspar Machera.
"What makes him Grand Master?"
Machera can catch a fish while bound and blindfolded. Some say he doesn’t even need a pole! We should all aspire to his level of expertise.
Catch and fillet fish until you have enough to report back to me.
We must survey the fish on the island to check for levels of Corruption. Then report to the Grand Master.
Greetings, young one. The tides spoke to me of your arrival. You carry fish from all over, yes? Yes, these are untainted. Good...
You've made great waves, little tadpole. The time has come to see if you can swim with the big ones.
Obtain {itemName}
Obtain {itemName}
Obtain {itemName}
Obtain {itemName}
To Be a Grand Master
Reach Fishing Level 100 and talk to Grand Master Machera in Reekwater.
"Hello, Grand Master."
You must learn to think like a fish if you are to catch fish of greater sizes and legendary species. Beside me I have a list of the legendary fish you can acquaint yourself with on Aeternum.
Reach your peak mastery of fishing and return to me.
"How do I reach my 'peak mastery'?"
Listen to the fish. Hear what they have to say, and understand what the water replies in turn. …Most practically, you must practice.
You are not yet one with the fish. Keep training, my minnow, and you will be rewarded for your efforts.
At last you are one with the fish. You have earned the title Master Fisher, and the respect of all the fishers on Aeternum.
Go forth and fish and be well, friend.
Reach Level 100 in the Fishing Skill
I must say, when the Watcher said we'd find a town, I expected more than this.
How did you manage to get past the Lost?
Those spectres are everywhere! There's no escaping them!
Another new face in Corinth. Have you come from the shore?
I'm anticipating a report from the Watcher on that terrible storm. Something's happening down there.
Hold up there, what business do you have in Corinth? A report from the Watcher, eh? OK, I'll take that.
So it was Corruption causing that hellish storm. Merde! Don't we have enough problems?
Hmm, according to Reese's report, you're quite the hero. Good for you!
Well, hero or not, we can't afford another mouth to feed. Corinth has gone from feast to famine.
"What happened?"
Ask five people, you'll get five theories. Some say we've been cursed, others blame the local Druids.
Some are even calling for the town's leader, the Speaker of the Winds, to step down. But he's doing what he can.
"Is there anything I can do to help?"
Oh right, the hero. Hate to break it to you, hero, but eternal life on Aeternum means eternal trouble.
But if you want to help, speak with Quartermaster Agrawal. Who knows? Maybe you two can fix everything!
Talk to the Quartermaster. If he says you can stay, then so be it.
So here's the one Watcher Reese lavished such high praise on! A real charge-in-and-hit-'em-where-it-counts kinda fighter!
We need more newcomers like you in Windsward. Everyone around here's gone so damn soft!
I suppose you've heard about the famine that's beset our lands. A crisis that demands action, not finger pointing.
Some people are claiming this was the work of the sorceress Medea, but that's a load of hogwash.
Spoken to the Captain, have you? He's normally not quite so dour. Although I suppose he was never a particularly charming man.
It's just that Windsward has just experienced a bit of bad luck recently.
But all that aside, you're still welcome in Corinth.
And really, I shouldn't suggest this famine is the result of bad luck. Our town leader, the "Speaker of the Winds" is entirely responsible for all this.
Let me know when you and Quartermaster Agrawal have solved our supply crisis.
I'll gather everyone together and we'll boost you up on our shoulders and parade you around town.
"What did the Speaker do?"
He broke a centuries-old tradition and stopped paying tribute to the Sorceress Medea.
She hasn't been seen or heard from in decades, so many have questioned whether she even exists. Seems the Speaker decided to find out.
"And stopping tribute caused the famine?"
It can’t simply be a coincidence. And I've heard the stories of Medea. She's not someone you cross.
The question is why the damn Speaker took it upon himself to cancel the tribute without consulting anyone.
"Maybe I should speak with him?"
Absolutely not, you're a guest! I insist you check in at the inn. You came ashore in that terrible storm, I'm sure you need rest.
In any case, it's my duty to talk to the man. This is my burden to bear.
I really do appreciate your offer to help, but I must decline.
Check yourself in at the inn and eat a warm meal. Assuming you can scrounge one, that is.
Welcome to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home
You wish to check in? Now this is a pleasant surprise, two new customers in one day!
Whether the Speaker decides to resume tribute or not, the real problem now is finding enough food to get us through the week.
I have my work cut out for me.
Well there you go! You can always count on me to tell it to you straight.
Get yourself on to the Trading Post. And if you need to stash anything, there's a storage shed as well. I'll be getting the lay of the land.
See, doesn't spending coin make you feel more alive? Glad one of us got what they needed.
I'm gonna have to find some richer places to plunder before I can get myself a boat and get off this damned rock.
The real tragedy of Corinth is there's no way a girl can make some quick money around here.
That daft town guard treats me like your servant, leaving me messages to give you. And not a single coin for it!
A Word with the Speaker
Speak with the Speaker of the Winds at the Town Hall in Corinth
Speak with the Speaker of the Winds
"A message? What did he say?"
He said your heroics on the shore got the attention of this so-called "Speaker of the Winds."
Sounds like a right charlatan to me. He's waiting for you in the town hall.
I won't be staying here long, but I'll make sure to leave a message when I head out.
"You don't think this is about the tribute?"
Of course not! That damned sorceress doesn't deserve our hard-earned goods. But that was a misunderstanding. We sent the damn tribute!
No, I think this curse was brought on by the Druids. They were the first to transform into soulless Lost.
"The Druids became Lost?"
Aye! Can you imagine such a tragedy? The very people we trusted to care for our crops became monsters and started this damn plague!
Now entire farms and villages are falling Lost - half of Windsward at this point!
"What can I do to help?"
Now that's the spirit! We need fighters, not whiners and nay-sayers!
Just now, Quartermaster Agrawal's headed to the farms to salvage what he can, but he's no warrior. Go and see if you can help.
Look for Quartermaster Agrawal on the road out by the farms.
Right, I won't be staying here long, but I'll make sure to leave a message when I head out.
Keep your eyes on the horizon, mate, and stay upwind of your enemies.
How many times do I have to tell people? We sent the damn tribute!
No matter, Captain Dupont will soon sort out who's been spreading such nasty rumors.
Your confidence seems matched by your skill, so I welcome the help.
Indeed, if you rescue anyone you can find, we might be able to get some answers.
I just can't believe that! They've always been kind and generous.
They often spoke of a Verdant Spirit who watched over Windsward. It was a lovely story...
I can't stay here. Too many memories destroyed along with these fields.
Whoever's responsible for this, I'm going to make sure they get what they deserve!
I've been on this island longer than I can recall, and I've rebuilt my life many times.
But I'm so tired… I can't start over again. I simply don't have the heart…
I've never heard of anyone who could snap their fingers and turn people Lost. If such magic exists, I'd like to know more about it myself.
No, this is something else, something related to the land itself.
The fall of the farms. The Swarmancers. It must be connected to the Tribute.
But we need more information. Something about the Speaker's story isn't adding up.
Are you… oh, no. You're not a soldier of the Iron Rose Company.
I had hoped some of my comrades might've been spared. But hope has withered here.
For god's sake! Where the hell did you come from? Did you see? The entire garrison has turned Lost!
My brave comrades are all soulless husks. I saw Cotheran fall… I thought I was surely next…
"The way is clear now so get moving!"
Yes, you're right! I can't just stand here awaiting death! My thanks to you, stranger! Brace yourself, Gideon, you can do this…
I'm fighting my way out of here, one way or another! I owe it to my Iron Rose comrades to survive! I will never forget you, dear friends!
What news from the garrison? What's this? Sergeant Cotheran's armband! Oh no...
The fall of Cotheran the Red, all the more tragic because she had been assigned to escort the tribute to Medea.
"She didn't take the tribute?"
No, we received a missive informing us that Guard Captain Dupont had already taken Medea's tribute.
It was highly irregular. Of course if Cotheran had gone, she might still have her soul…
"What if Medea didn't get it?"
Are you suggesting the curse is Medea's doing? Dear god, I hope not. Commander Merrill stayed in close communication with the Sorceress.
If she failed to receive tribute, the Commander would've received a very prompt letter.
"We should investigate."
I cannot raise arms against my fallen comrades. You must fight your way into the Iron Keep alone. I must see the Speaker.
Find what you can, then use the Spirit Shrine to meet me in Corinth. Valor is a beacon, friend!
Do you have any information about the tribute? Commander Merrill would keep his correspondence on his desk.
This is all the proof we need, however. You should confront him. If he denies it, call me for the bashing.
Ah! The hero who restored our Windmills returns from the field!
Gratitude is in short supply in Corinth these days, but I, for one, salute your courage!
"We'll still recover the tribute."
I don't know, but it can't hurt. If Medea's not responsible for the curse, we could use her help.
But truth be told, I need a drink and about a week of sleep. I wouldn't make a good comrade-in-arms right now.
"It's alright. I'll go alone."
We've tangled with the Buccaneer Creek Pirates - they're crafty. If you're going alone, always smart to set up a camp. There's a good spot near the pirates' den.
I'll be at the tavern. Strength be with you, soldier.
I'm still trying to shake those images out of my mind. Those soldiers… I fought alongside them for decades.
I never thought the Iron Rose would end up like this.
I just can't get over it. All this pain because the Speaker decided he'd let the town guard take the tribute this season.
What the hell was he thinking?
Maybe that's your tribute! But hey, if you’re going in there, grab some loot. We'll split the profit.
I see by your expression you realized the same thing I did. Didn't want to discourage you, but your tribute was all gone.
But tell me you at least found something of value!
"Yes, the pirates' deal with the Speaker."
Well now, that's right devious. Not sure if I'm disappointed or impressed with the bastard.
But don't judge me, I'd never betray and steal from innocents. I just steal from those who deserve it. Speaking of which...
"Yes, I also found some loot."
Have I told you lately how much I like you? You got a hero's heart, and a clever mind. And you're a trusty mate.
We should partner up for a little more looting. Maybe even find something to help the town.
I couldn't help but notice mention in the Speaker's note of some kinda precious gemstones.
I know for a fact that these same pirates have another hideout just a stone's throw away.
"Alright, we should check it out."
If we find this so-called “Verdant Gemstone,” we could always sell it back to the town.
Oh, don't look at me like that! Fine! I guess if you're the one going in, it'll be your call. Surely, we'll get something for it.
"Did you scout this area also?"
Aye, and if you're going in, I'd recommend the bold approach myself. Just blast through the gate like you own the place!
But don't get cocky, that captain fights with a right nasty boat anchor.
Think of that precious gemstone, all alone in that hostile place. It's a right heartache!
So this is where the trail of the missing tribute leads? The lies from the Speaker of the Winds just keep piling up.
I must say, I'm quite happy to find someone here other than those foul pirates.
And Grace mentioned a letter that referred to a priceless "Verdant Gemstone?" I don't suppose you found such a thing, did you?
"Yes, it was the pirates' payment."
I can't believe it! Please, may I see it? Amazing...
It's both ironic and incredibly lucky that you found this. You see, I'm convinced Medea did not cause this curse. I believe it's this Verdant Gemstone.
You know, over all these years, I've really come to enjoy living here in Winsward.
With the Iron Rose Company gone, I'll be moving on. But it's really a damn shame.
The Druidic scrolls mention a Verdant Spirit that's protected Windsward for centuries.
I thought it was just a superstition, but there was an annual tradition to visit the Verdant Shrines where the gemstones were kept.
Think of that precious gemstone, all alone in that hostile place. It's a right heartache!
One thing's for sure, it's of no use to those rotters now that they've fallen Lost.
I'm a bit disappointed. I thought you and I had a profitable plan before little-miss-bright-eyes came along.
I suppose you'll be wanting to be all generous now. I guess you’ve earned the right to make that decision.
"So there's more than one?"
There are four altogether. One is safe in the warren of Thornhall. We will need to find and restore the other three.
But first, this gemstone must be returned to its place in the Mirador Shrine. There is a catch, however.
"What's the catch?"
Mirador is a ruin that dates back to the time of the Ancients. It's quite likely protected by Ancient Guardians.
But if you can get past them and solve the shrine's puzzle, the rest is easy. And I believe in you!
Are you bolstering your courage? I find it helps to imagine something inspiring, like a big slice of lime and elderberry pie. Mmm...
"The jewel has been replaced!"
Oh! You did it! I may have sensed some kind of change in the flora here. Of course, I'm just an apprentice Druid.
Oh. Your friend Grace seems a little disappointed. I think she had other plans for the gemstone.
Everything we're doing here is for the benefit of Corinth. But I do believe Francis Turner needs to be held to account.
His dealings with the pirates must be exposed. And the town needs a new Speaker of the Winds.
"I'm sure Grace understands…"
Oh, I understand all right! The two of you have decided to play noble heroes and save the land. And I'm leaving here nearly empty-handed.
I'm the one who scouted out the Pirates, you know! I deserve something for my troubles.
"The Speaker owes us all a debt"
Have you visited the towers yet? They certainly stand out. Can't get lost with the towers to guide your way.
I wish we knew more about them. They had to be created for some greater purpose!
"You could help us, you know."
Oh, so now you want to recruit me into your charity project. I'd refuse but I'll enjoy this.
That Captain Dupont was a right arsehole to me. I'll hang 'em both out to dry. I'll see you back in town.
"What about the other Gemstones?"
My thoughts exactly. I'll visit the library in Corinth to try and find the location of the other shrines.
Honestly though, I’d love to see the expression on Francis Turner's face. Talk about priceless.
"Alright, let's go to town."
There's one of those Spirit Shrines over that way, if that's your fancy.
I prefer an honest walk myself. Either way, I'll race you. I'll have that Speaker strung up before you even get there!
I must say, I'm feeling much better now that we have a plan. And I think this has at least some chance of being successful.
Perfect timing! I've just come from Historian Moira, and I need your help.
Moira says there's a map showing the shrine's locations engraved on a monument in the ancient ruins of Breakwater Bulwark.
Once again, you show up just in time! Can I see the map rubbing? Ah, yes, I can see the locations of the two other shrines quite clearly.
There's no end to what we could learn from the ancients. If you wish to know more, you should speak to my son Elric.
He's been studying the spheres, those fascinating artifacts!
So I tried having a chat with that lying oaf Francis Turner, but that bastard Captain Dupont wouldn't let me pass.
I was trying to think who we could trust here. Maybe that dandy Quartermaster?
"Yes, he can be trusted."
Good. If we can get him on our side, and maybe a couple more, we'll have a little revolution started.
You go talk to your Quartermaster mate, and I'll hit the tavern. Always the best place for conspiring, you know?
"He made a deal with the pirates. I have proof."
Oh, I simply must see this… Hah! The dirty liar's been caught red-handed!
But we need to be strategic here. We'll need strength in arms if we're to challenge the Speaker. We've got you, but then maybe a soldier or two?
"Yes. Talk to Leovix of the Iron Rose."
Ah, yes! I saw him in the inn earlier, making preparations to leave town. I'll go and speak with him straightaway.
In the meantime, that young Druid you rescued out at the farm was looking for you. She's a sharp one.
So, I've spoken with Leovix and your friend, Grace O'Malley.
The two of them, you and I, and the Druid… I think we have a nice little resistance cooking.
"Can we take a rubbing of it?"
Ha ha! Great minds think alike! I've already procured you some charcoal and parchment.
Oh… Moira also mentioned the Bottomless Cup has the first half of the map. Might be worth checking out before heading to Breakwater.
"I love a good scavenger hunt."
Now, we must expose the Speaker and force him to tell us where the other Verdant Gemstones are.
There's just one problem: Captain Leovix seems intent on tying the Speaker to a rock and throwing him into the sea.
"I can understand his anger."
Yes, of course, we all can. But we need the information the Speaker possesses.
You'll have to convince Leovix to wait until we know where the other gemstones are. In any case, I'm in favor of justice but against violence.
Part of becoming a Druid is taking vows of non-violence. If removing the Speaker really requires bloodshed, I'll be staying out of the fray.
“We need information first."
Yes, everyone keeps telling me, the location of some stolen jewels, right?
The Company of the Iron Rose is well-versed in the arts of persuasion. My blade can be very convincing.
“Let me talk to them first.”
Very well. I’ll stay my blade. For now. Those scoundrels best pray to whatever spirits rule this hell that you are successful.
And quickly, or else the streets of Corinth will be awash with their blood.
You and that brute Leovix are up to something, aren't you? He's been eyeing me like a hungry wolf.
His grudge is misplaced. As the Speaker and I have explained, the Buccaneer Creek Pirates are to blame.
"I have your hat, Marcel. One chance to come clean."
My hat? I believe I lost that in, uh, town. Someone must have picked it up. My hat proves nothing.
"Do you think Leovix will believe that?"
Ah, merde! Fine! None of this was my idea, you realize!
Francis convinced me that we would both get rich off this plan. I was a fool to listen to him!
"Where are the Verdant Gemstones?"
Those cursed things! Superstition or not, I never wanted anything to do with them!
Look, I only know he has one of the jewels stashed in the Town Hall. Expose him! The oaf deserves it! Just leave me in peace, yes?
Please, I beg you, don't let Leovix do whatever it is that he's thinking of doing.
I'll leave here and you'll never hear from me again. You have my word!
Ah, but this is so unlike you! Why are you snooping around here?
Sit down and have a drink with me. If there's some misunderstanding, I'm sure we can work it out.
"Too late. I found the gemstone."
That? Why I’ve never seen it before! If you found that here in the Town Hall, it must have been planted.
It was probably Captain Dupont! As the Speaker, I order you to apprehend that… traitor!
"You're not Speaker any more."
Oh really? Well, I guess this is it, isn't it? Francis Turner's corruption exposed! I bet everyone's overjoyed.
All I ever wanted was for this town to stand up against the Sorceress Medea. My intentions were good!
"Not buying it. Where's the third gemstone?"
I'm afraid that found its way into the coffers of Captain Korrapati. Good luck recovering that.
But I, I've told you the truth now. I assume this earns me some leniency, right? Right? Are you even listening to me?
Come now, you wouldn't let anyone come after your good old friend, Francis, would you?
I will leave peacefully and trouble no one. I promise. Just give me time to gather my things…
Oh by the way, we'll need to escort Francis and Captain Dupont out of town without Leovix seeing.
I'll talk to Quartermaster Agrawal about dealing with the two criminals.
And then I can start asking around town about this Captain Korrapati character.
Did you manage to restore the third Verdant Gemstone? Strange, I thought I would sense something, but it's very faint.
Could it be because I'm still just an apprentice? I have much to learn…
Corinth is doing better than before. There is order and calm in the streets with Saatvik as the new Speaker of the Winds.
And he's moved quickly to resume the tribute to Medea, so it should already be on its way.
Under New Management
Return to Corinth and speak with the the New Speaker of the Winds.
Speak with Saatvik Agrawal
"We should head back there."
You definitely should. But now that we've restored the third gemstone, I'm going to visit the Druidic Warren of Thornhall.
I'm hoping by some miracle my fellow Druids are restored as well. I'll see you in town after!
When I see you in town, we'll celebrate with a slice of lime and elderberry pie.
Welcome home, comrade! I have assumed the duties of heading up the Town Guard.
So I am a bit preoccupied right now. You should see the Speaker Agrawal.
Thank the stars you've returned! If the final gemstone has been restored, then that should mean we will soon have reprieve from the famine.
I fear that hunger is quickly eroding the townspeople's patience with their new Speaker.
Unfortunately, there are new developments that may plunge us back into chaos just as we were starting to have hope.
Just minutes ago, Captain Leovix sent word that the tribute encountered trouble on the road.
"Was Leovix escorting it?"
Sadly no. He's overwhelmed with the duties of Town Guard Captain, so he sent some of his new recruits.
Captain Leovix should be down at the gate. Please find out if anything can be done.
Please talk to Captain Leovix and do whatever is necessary to secure the tribute. We can't afford another disaster right now.

To the honorable and wise Lady Medea,

I can certainly understand your displeasure with the town of Corinth for not delivering the seasonal Tribute on schedule, but I hope you will accept my apology and renewed commitment to honor our covenant. 

The former Speaker of the Winds led Corinth with a forked tongue. He had forgotten our promise and the stories of how you have repaid personal betrayals in the past. 

For that very reason, he has been removed from office, and I have been sworn in as the new Speaker. It is my solemn hope to resume the good relations our settlement once enjoyed with you.

In this cart you will find tribute in double the usual quantities, as recompense for late delivery.

I hope you will please reconsider any actions you have taken against our town as punishment for our failure. I know that with your guidance we can return stronger and more fruitful than ever. 

Your humble servant,
Saatvik Agrawal, Speaker of the Winds.
Good thing you're here, comrade. You won't believe it, but my recruits just returned with confirmation that the new tribute has come under attack.
I was about to go myself, but if you're willing, I’d prefer it were you.
"Of course, just tell me where to go."
The caravan came under attack at the Bulrush Wash river crossing. I'm told it's a full onslaught of Lost.
Recover what you can, including the Speaker's letter to Medea. I'll prepare a new wagon. Strength be with you!
Whatever it takes, we will save this town, goddamn it! If we have to send tribute a hundred times, that's what we'll do.
Abominable Luck
Track down the missing tribute for Speaker Saatvik.
X_"Was Leovix escorting it?"
X_Sadly no. He's overwhelmed with the duties of Town Guard Captain, so he sent some of his new recruits.
X_Captain Leovix should be down at the gate. Please find out if anything can be done.
X_Please talk to Captain Leovix and do whatever is necessary to secure the tribute. We can't afford another disaster right now.
Speak with Leovix Silva in Corinth
Travel to {POITags} to find the missing tribute
Read "Tribute and Reparations"
Collect "Tribute and Reparations"
Behold the cost of breaking your covenant with the Sorceress Medea!
Once again I am shown that people cannot be trusted to keep their word!
"But this is your tribute!"
Think you a wagon full of goods can appease me? When you have also defiled the shrines I crafted here?
No, Windsward must suffer far more before I relent.
What's done is done. I shall no longer stand idly by while my work is scorned, broken, disrupted.
They shall soon see the terrible glory of my craft!
Every time I have to see the terrible fate that's befallen my fellow Druids, I shudder at the horror.
After all our work restoring the Verdant Gemstones, this is enough to make even me lose hope.
This would suggest the famine was Medea's doing all along, but she's only resorted to such cruelty because of the Verdant Gemstones.
Moira mentioned something about Medea's involvement in building the shrines.
I was headed out to the warren when I witnessed this. Just when we thought everything might start getting better.
I had no idea Medea could command this sort of power.
"So she's mad about tribute and the shrines?"
Yes, and now she's the one preventing the land from healing. There is a fourth Verdant Gemstone within Thornhall, you see.
She has taken the warren for herself and removed the gemstone to ensure the curse cannot be lifted.
"We'll have to convince her."
She may not listen to reason, but she must be confronted. My powers pale compared to hers, so I’d be of little help.
But if anyone can defeat a powerful sorceress like Medea, it will be you. My last hope goes with you.
You are beyond brave to challenge Medea. Her power is truly staggering.
Nothing I've learned in all my studies has prepared me for this.
I've heard of Druids falling ill, or even becoming Lost, but some truly foul magic is at work here.
You know, over all these years, I've really come to enjoy living here in Windsward. With the Iron Rose Company gone, I'll be moving on. But it's really a damn shame.
But you've made all of this possible. You've restored hope to all of Windsward. I'm quite impressed!
My hopes for the other Druids being restored were not realized. My next steps were uncertain.
But after serious contemplation, I've decided to seek out Medea. I wish to become her apprentice and learn her craft.
About time someone came to help! Meet me at the edge of the farm - we should talk!
If Medea's responsible for this curse, I fear it will only get worse.
That sorceress is ruthless in a way these people simply do not understand. Those tributes are dear to her.
"So you think Medea did this?"
I don’t know. But this is precisely why Medea entrusted the Iron Rose with the responsibility for the tribute.
The Company has never failed to honor a contract, and now the damned Speaker has tarnished our reputation.
"Did you speak with him?"
No, the bastard wouldn't see me, of course. And now I'd only bash his face in.
You made it-- I almost called you comrade. Did you find anything in the Iron Keep? Ah, so there was correspondence from Medea.
Good heavens! She never received the tribute. She is most displeased.
And if that vicious Sorceress wants a war over this, we should give her one!
Ah, now it makes sense! I scouted the place and noticed they seemed to have a boat load of supplies.
I'll meet you back here once I'm done. I can't wait until the land is restored. It's going to be marvelous!
You'll have to forgive me. I've just spoken with the Sorceress Medea herself. I'm at a loss for words.
I still can't believe that you defeated her, that this is happening.
"What did she say?"
She said that you've proven the people here are worthy, and that she allowed you to restore the final Verdant Gemstone.
I think she wishes to speak with you now. I need to find somewhere to sit down…
Behold, the gifted warrior who bested me approaches. I am sorely tempted to test you once again.
"Is that really necessary?"
No, but it would be diverting. You possess a rare power not found among newcomers to Aeternum.
Another possesses this power, but I will not speak her name. She’s the Herald of Corruption, and far more dangerous than you.
"I hear her voice."
Oh… Then Corruption already has its hooks in you. Hm... They will be extremely difficult to remove.
It would be foolish for me to take a stand. I'll simply wait for this tempest to blow over.
"What can I do?"
There's an old man fishing the river not far from here. His simpleminded demeanor belies great wisdom. Seek him out if you would fight Corruption.
As for me, I will bid you farewell… for now.
"That sounds dangerous."
The decision is not without its perils. But imagine how I could’ve helped Windsward if I had possessed Medea's gifts.
This power can be used for great good. I will devote my life to making it so. I dearly hope we meet again.
<g id="female_youknow" />Ah. The farms may be unproductive and overrun, but luckily, animals are still abundant.
<g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I have mixed feelings about hunting puma, to be frank.
Give a Dog a Bone (Expedition)
Barkimedes nuzzles you happily, grateful for the bones.
Barkimedes nuzzles you happily, grateful for the bones.
